Description: ཀུད་gives as the present of བཀུ་
/p.ཀུམ་ /ps.ཀུམ་ /f.ཀུམ་/int. /m. (archaic) To die./n. Compare: 'gum
/p.ཀེར་ /ps.ཀེརད་ ཀེར་ /f.ཀེར་/imp.ཀེརད་ -./inv. /vl./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To erect, to point a finger toward the sky To raise, lift up. To raise up (e.g. a finger) To arise, get up.
ཀོང་ gives as the present of བཀོང་

/aux.ཀྲང་ (ངག་དབང་ཚུལ་ཁྲིམ་ 1997)./fn.(archaic, main verb un-negated) Signifies the successful execution of an action.(archaic) A question word similar to gam, ngam, &c. (ངགདབངཚུལཁྲིམ་ 1997)./n. Compare: གྲང་2
ཀྲབས་ gives as the present of བཀྲབ་
ཀྲོངས་ gives as the present of དགྲོངས་
/p.ཀླན་ /ps.ཀླན་ /f.ཀླན་/tr., m. 1. To wreak revenge for. [2. To mend, to patch] 1. To avenge, to take revenge. 2. To answer, counter (archaic) To answer, counter.
ཀླལ་  give as a present of གླལ་

/p.ཀླས་(ngag dbang tshul khrim 1997)/m. To be beyond, further￼than 1. To forget. 2. To arrive at the depths, meet the limit. 3. To understand (ngag dbang tshul khrim 1997)./n. prefer to see this as an adjective.

/p.ཀླུབ་ /ps.ཀླུབས་ /f.ཀླུབ་/imp.ཀླུབས་/cs.ལྷུབ་པ་/m. To cover the body with ornaments (Ja), to put on luxuriously (Cs), to set up a tent To put on; to wear./n. Root given as klub < *s-'-ལྷུབ་ *b-ལྷུབ་?
/p.ཀླུབས་ཀླུབ་ /ps.བླུབས་(see note). བཀླུབས་ /f.ཀླུབས་

བཀླུབ་/imp.ལྷུབས་(see note).klubs /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.lhub pa[Chang 1971: iv.13]/ch.ex.ན་བཟའ་སོགས་/m. To adorn, put on another person; to make someone put on To ornament, put on clothes 1. To wear. 2. To adorn, decorate./n. Root given as g + lhub./n. For the form blubs (a. 1680) see (Eimer 1987); suggests the inflection ཀླུབ་ བླུབས་ *ཀླུབ་ *ལྷུབས་; for the imperative he compares lhab lhub 'excessively bedecked'.

/p.ཀློག་ /ps.བླགས་(see note).bklags.klags. /f.བཀླག་ TD ཧས་ བཀྲག bya as the future, but this is obviously a mistake. klag/imp.ཀློགས་ལྷོགས་ /vl., /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.མདོ་སྔ་སོགས་bka' bstan dang yi ge sogs. ཡིགེ་/m. To read To read aloud./n. Root given as klag < *s-'-ལྷག་ *g + ལྷག་/n. This form was first noted by (Nobel 1955) it is discussed in (de Jong 1974) who finds the forms p+lags, ph+lags, and p+ལྷགས་ as well. suggests the inflection klog, blags, klag, ལྷོགས་
/p.དཀག་ /ps.དཀག་ /f.དཀག་/int./m. (of a melted liquid ) To solidify in the process of cooling.
/p.དཀའ་ /ps.དཀའ་/synt. [a.o] /m. To be difficult.
/p.དཀུ་ /ps.དཀུ་ /f.དཀུ་/imp.- /int/synt. [Abs, Obl.] /m.To drip, come down, fall.1. To brew, exude. 2. To fall. 3. (archaic) To remain, be left behind.
/p.དཀོནད་ /ps.དཀོནད་ /f.དཀོན་/imp.དཀོནད་/ch.ex.འཇིགརྟེནསོགསསུ་/m. To appear (ངག་དབང་ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་ 1997).

/p.དཀྱུ་ (archaic)འཁྱུས་ /ps.དཀྱུས་ /f.དཀྱུ་/imp.དཀྱུས་/tr/synt. [e.a]./cs. འཁྱུས་[] /ch.ex.རྟ་སོགས་bros pa'i/m. 1. To run a race 2. To wring out; to filter (Sch.) 3. To caper about (Ja) To race, to run away To race (a horse, mule, &c.) To control, ride a horse./n. see note at འཁྱུས་
/p.དཀྱུད་/m. To forget.

/p.དཀྲི་བཀྲི་ /ps.དཀྲིས་ /f.དཀྲི་/imp.དཀྲིས་-./inv. /vl. /tr./synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྲི་ འཁྲིལ་ /ch.ex.དར་སོགས་ཀྱིས་dar sogs/m. 1. (archaic) To conduct one's pupil from one stage of learning to another stage. 2. To wind; to wrap around. 3. To ensnare To wind, to wrap up; to roll up To bind something with string or rope 1. To bind, to tie. 2. To cover, impose, accuse, deprecate.

/p.དཀྲིག་ /ps.དཀྲིགས་ /f.དཀྲིག་/imp.ཁྲིགས་LS. དཀྲིགས་ /vl. /tr/synt. [a.o]./cs.འཁྲིག་/ch.ex.དུ་སྤྲིན་སོགས་/m. To make overcast; to gather clouds [sic], to pile up To fill up (with clouds, smoke &c.).To obscure.

/p.དཀྲུག་ /ps.དཀྲུགས་  /f.དཀྲུག་ /imp.དཀྲུགས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྲུག་ .Cognate with:sprug/ch.ex.ཞོ་དང་ཐུགས་སོགས་/m. To disturb, put in motion; to turn, turn on a lathe To stir up; to disturb; to agitate; to disunite; to create differences by instigation 1. To stir, churn (a kind of liquid with a stick). 2. To be unharmonious, disagreeable. 3. To finish, conclude 1. To disturb, stir, churn. 2. To agitate, disrupt. 3. To carve by turning on a lathe./n. Root given as dkrug < *b-krug./n. Compare: dkrog.
/p.དཀྲུམ་ /ps.དཀྲུམས་ /f.དཀྲུམ་/imp.དཀྲུམས་ /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཅོངཞི་སོགས་ /m. To break; to crack To break into bits To break (fragile objects).

/p.དཀྲོག་ དཀྲོགས་ /ps.དཀྲོགས་ /f.དཀྲོག་/imp.དཀྲོགས་ - /vl. /inv./tr/synt. [e.a].Active of:skrog. /cs.འཁྲོག་ [Duff]/ch.ex.ཞོ་སོགས་ sto dang bya sogs(dkrogs).zho dang bya sogs(dkrogs). zho (-) /m. 1. To churn; to agitate, mingle, trouble. 2. To rouse; scare up; to wag, e.g. the tail (Ja) To stir up; to churn; to give a feeling of surprise to; to disturb; to open. 1. To stir, churn. 2. To startle, surprise 1. To churn, agitate, stir. 2. To disturb./n. Root given as dkrog < b-krog /n. Compare: dkrug
དཀྲོལ་ give as the present of འཁྲོལ༡་

/p.བཀན་ /ps.བཀནད་ བཀན་ /f.བཀན་/imp.བཀནད་ -.བཀན་ /vl. /inv.ND/tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ལུས་དང་ཐལ་མོ་སོགས་ lag par sogs(bkand).lag pa sogs(bkand).lag pas(-) /m. 1. To up-root, turn up anything by applying a stick at its foot or root. 2. To bend. 3. To put; to press; to apply (Ja). 4. To hold fast; to extend (Cs). 1. To raise up. 2. To firmly press 1. To turn face upwards. 2. To hold firmly, to press down. 3. To neglect.

/p.བཀུ་ ཀུད་ /ps.བཀུས་ /f.བཀུ་/imp.ཀུས་ བཀུས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./res.skud[].Denominative of:ཁུ་བ་ «juice»/ch.ex.སྨན་གྱི་ཁུ་བ་སོགས་ sman dang snum sogs/m. To make extract of a drug by drawing out the juice To extract juice by boiling.To extract a medicinal infusion.

/p.བཀུར་འཁུར་  /ps.བཀུརད་ བཀུར་ /f.བཀུར་/imp.བཀུར་ཁུརད་ /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.མཆོག་དང་གོང་དུ་gtsug tu /m. I. To pay homage or reverence; to esteem. 2. To slander, to blaspheme To respect, venerate To respect.To make offering, serve, respect.
བཀུར་ gives as a present of འཁུར་

/p.བཀོང་ ཀོང་ /ps.བཀོངས་ བཀོང་ /f.བཀོང་/imp.བཀོང་ ཀོངས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.སྦ་སོགས་ /m. To break the pride of somebody; to cause￼to become a coward To discourage, intimidate, humble To frighten, intimidate, discourage./n. Compare: འཁོང་ and འགོང་
/p.བཀོང་ /ps.བཀོང་ /f.བཀོང་/int. /m. To be wrinkled.
བཀོན་ give as the present of འཁོན་
བཀོལ་ give as the present of འཁོལ༣་

/p.བཀྱོན་ /ps.བཀྱོནད་ བཀྱོན་ /f.བཀྱོན་/imp.བཀྱོན་ བཀྱོནད་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཚིག་གམ་བཀས་/m. To beat, to chastise To scold; to admonish (honorific) To speak roughly to someone (honorific) To scold, reprimand.
/p.བཀྲ་ /ps.བཀྲ་/m. To be beautiful, clear, multicolored (, list as an adject ive).
Past (?):bkrags. /vl./synt. [e.a] /m. To roast, grill./n. imply a connection to sreg

/p.ཀྲབས་ བཀྲབ་ /ps.བཀྲབས་ /f.བཀྲབ་/imp.ཀྲོབས་ བཀྲབས་ བཀྲོབས /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.འཁོར་དང་གྲོགས་སོགས་/m. To choose or select from among many (archaic) To select from among many To choose, select.
/p.བཀྲལ་ འགྲེལ་ /ps.བཀྲལ་ བཀྲལད་ /f.བཀྲལ་ /imp.བཀྲོལ་ འགྲེལད་ /vl./tr.Denominative of:ཁྲལ་ «tax»[]/m. To appoint To share tax payment To impose (a tax).
བཀྲི་ (archaic) give as the present of འཁྲིད༡་
བཀྲུག་ (Ja) give as an alternate or erroneous present of དཀྲུག་
/p.བཀྲེས་ (archaic). /ps.བཀྲེས་ /f.བཀྲེས་ /imp.བཀྲེས་ -./inv./int./synt. [a.o].Denominative of:བཀྲེས་ «hunger» []/m. To be hungry To feel hungry
/p.བཀྲོས་ /ps.བཀྲོས་ /f.བཀྲོས་/imp.བཀྲོས་/m. To choose; to select.

/p.བརྐམ་ རྐོམ་ རྐམ[ (archaic)]. /ps.བརྐམ་ བརྐམས་ /f.བརྐམ་/imp.བརྐམ་ རྐམས་ རྐོམས - /vl./inv./int/synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཟས་ནོར་སོགས་ལ་'dod la/m.To desire, long for (as a child for sweets) To be attached to, to yearn for.

/p.རྐུ་ /ps.བརྐུས་ /f.བརྐུ་/imp.རྐུས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a].Denominative of:རྐུན་མ་'thief'[]/ch.ex.གཞན་གྱི་ནོར་སོགས་ gzhan nor sogs rkun ma /m. To steal; to rob. To steal; to take away unlawfully To steal, to take by sleight the property of another which has not been given or paid for.

/p.རྐོ་ རྐོད་ /ps.བརྐོས་ /f.བརྐོ་/imp.རྐོས་ /vl./int/synt. [e.a].Denominative of:རྐ་ «furrow» /ch.ex.ཁྲོན་པ་སོགས་ {sa dang dpar sogs} {sa drang spar sogs} /m. 1. To dig, dig out; to hoe. 2. To engrave; turn up; till To inscribe; to dig; to engrave; to print To dig (a hole in the ground &c.) 1. To dig, excavate. 2. To carve out letters and designs (in stone, wood &c.).

/p.རྐོན་ /ps.བརྐོནད་ /f.བརྐོན་/imp.རྐོནད་/den.རྐོན་ «a net, trap» []/m. To trap or catch in a trap. /n. From colloquial data hypothesizes a verb *bskon 'to cause to get caught, hung up i.e. to hang on a peg' as the causative of *ཁོན་ or *འཁོན་ 'to get caught, hung up'. Perhaps confirms her hypothesis.
རྐོམ་ gives as the present of རྐམ་
རྐྱག་ gives as a present of སྐྱག་
/p.རྐྱལ་ /ps.བརྐྱལ་ རྐྱལ་ /f.རྐྱལ་/imp.རྐྱོལད་ རྐྱོལ་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]￼/ch.ex.ཆུ་བོ་/m. To swim, to amuse oneself by swimming (Ja) To swim

/p.རྐྱོང་ /ps.བརྐྱངས་ /f.བརྐྱང་/imp.རྐྱོངས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a].Denominative of:རྐང་ «foot» /ch.ex.ཡན་ལག་སོགས་ zhabs sogs yan lag. /m. To stretch, extend, stretch forth (one's hands to a person), put out (the tongue); spread; distend (the wings, a curtain) To stretch out one's arms; to extend To extend, stretch (the feet, hands &c.) To stretch, spread out, extend./n. Related to རྒྱོང་

/p.ལྐུག་ ལྐུགས་  /ps.ལྐུགས་ /f.ལྐུག་ ལྐུགས་ /imp.ལྐུགས་ -./inv./int/synt. [a.o].Denominative of:ལྐུག་ «dumb, mute» []/m. To become foolish; to become dumb To become unable to speak clearly To be dumb, to be unable to talk, to loose one's voice.
/p.སྐད་ /ps.སྐད་ /f.སྐད་/tr.Denominative of:སྐད་ «language,  speech» []/m. To say, tell, relate The written equivalent of zhes and zer which mark the end of quoted speech.
/p.སྐམ་ /ps.བསྐམས་སྐམ་(Hoshi 2003). /f.བསྐམ་/imp.སྐམས་/inv./int./m. To make thirsty To dry up, dry out /n. Compare: skem
/p.སྐར་ /ps.བསྐར་/imp.སྐོར་ /vl./m. To hangup; to weigh.
སྐུ་ gives as an alternate present of སྐུད་

/p.སྐུག་ /ps.བསྐུགས་ /f.བསྐུག་/imp.སྐུགས་ /inv. /int. /synt. [e.a] /m. For the winner not comply with the game of taking wealth, after a dispute over victory and defeat To make a bet, to bet, to gambol.

/p.སྐུང་ /ps.བསྐུངས་ /f.བསྐུང་/imp.བསྐུངས་ /vl. /tr.,  ￼/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དབེན་པ་སོགས་སུ་ sbed pa'i /m. To hide in the ground, to bury, to inter To hide; to keep secret 1. To hide away. 2. To write the symbol «X» as a substitute for following words which are repeated in lines of verse, or other expression To hide, conceal.

/p.སྐུད་ སྐུ་ /ps.བསྐུས་ /f.བསྐུ་/imp.སྐུས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.bku[]/ch.ex.སྣུ་མ་སོགས་ sman sogs /m. To smear, to besmear; to daub To anoint; to apply oil or ointment To put (dye, oil &c.) on the surface of something To apply, put on, cover, smear.

/p.སྐུམ་ /ps.བསྐུམས་ /f.བསྐུམ་TD སེཨེམས to have dskum bya as the future, but bskum must be meant./imp.སྐུམས་ སྐུམ་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs. འཁུམ་/ch.ex.ཡན་ལག་སོགས་ rkanglagsogs /m. To contract; to be drawn up; to be paralyzed To withdraw, to draw in; to make shorter or smaller; to contract; to conceal The opposite of produce, extend 1. To contract, bend, pull in. 2. To conceal, to obfuscate.

/p.སྐུར་ /ps.བསྐུརད་བསྐུར་ /f.བསྐུར་ /imp.སྐུརད་ སྐུར་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁུར་ /ch.ex.དབང་དང་འགན་/m. To bestow, give, send To make someone carry; to send; to cause to venerate on, to make someone pay respect 1. To deliver to the place of delivery by entrusting (a thing, letter &c.) with another person, post office. 2. For something to be carried (on the water, wind &c.) 1. To send, dispatch. 2. To give, bestow, entrust, assign.

/p.སྐུལ་ /ps.བསྐུལད་ བསྐུལ་ /f.བསྐུལ་/imp.སྐུལད་ སྐུལ་  /vl. /tr/synt. [Erg. Abs] /ch.ex.ཆོས་བསྐུལ་སོགས་TD thug rgyud las sogs la las la dang dge la /m. To excite; to exhort, admonish, enjoin To induce; exhort, urge; to request to do something; to persuade To motivate, incite 1. To induce, compel, persuade. 2. To incite, motivate.

[1]/p.སྐེམ་ སྐེམས་སྐམ. /ps.བསྐམས་ /f.བསྐམ་/imp.སྐོམས་ སྐེམས་￼. སྐམས་ /vl./int/synt. [Erg. Obl.].Denominative of:སྐེམ་ སྐམ་ «dry» []/ch.ex.ཆུ་སོགས་  is unclear, []lu sogs?. gos gsher ba dang me tog sogs /m. To make dry, to dry up To dry To make fewer, to dehydrate. To dry out, to dry.
[2]/p.སྐེམས་ སྐེམ་ /ps.བསྐམས་ /f.བསྐམ་/imp.-/inv./tr.Denominative of:སྐེམ་ སྐམ་ «dry» []/ch.ex.ཁ་ ཁ་སོགས་[]. /m. To wilt (of plants), become dry.

/p.སྐོ་ /ps.བསྐོས་ /f.བསྐོ་ /imp.སྐོས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དཔོན་གྱོགསོགས་las sne sogs.rgyal sar/m. To select; to appoint, nominate, commission, charge To appoint For leaders or people to give responsibility to a person for a task To appoint. 2. To be determined by the power of past deeds./n.(Uray 1972: 19) connects this verb with མཁོས་/ཁོས་/ཁོད་ 'institution, administration, settlement of the state' along with the verbs, འཁོད་ and འགོད་

[1]/p.སྐོང་ /ps.བསྐངས་ /f.བསྐང་ /imp.སྐོངས་ /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a].Denominative of:སྐང་བ་ «satisfaction» (Rona-Tas 1985: 179)/ch.ex.ཐུགས་དམ་སོགས་thugs dam dang re ba sogs.thugs dam/m. To fulfill To complete; to add; to satisfy, fulfill a wish 1. To fulfill. 2. To make up a deficiency; to supplement.
[2]/p.སྐོང་ /ps.བསྐོངས་ /f.བསྐོང་/imp.སྐོངས་ /vl./tr./synt. [e.a] /m. To summon, convene.

/p.སྐོན་ /ps.བསྐོནད་བསྐོན་ /f.བསྐོན་/imp.སྐོནད་སྐོན་ /vl./tr/synt. [Erg. Obl.]./cs.gon gyon  འཁོན་/ch.ex.ཁྲབ་རྨོག་ལྟ་བུ་སོགས་gos sogs/m. To dress; to clothe another person To make someone put on a dress or an ornament 1. To make someone wear (wools, a hat &c.). 2. To cause an action similar to the wearing of hats or clothes (e.g. bridle a horse, tie a rope around a calf's neck) To dress, put on clothes, to cover./n.Written Tibetan སྐོན་ བསྐོན་ བསྐོན་ «to dress, to clothe another person»: གོན་ «to put on (clothes, shoes)» appears to be an example of the devoicing caused by s similar to སྤུབ་ འབུབ་ Our spoken Tibetan data, however, does not confirm this meaning of སྐོན་ suggesting rather two bases, ￼*ཀོན་ «to get caught», and *གོན་ «to get dressed».

/p.སྐོམ་ /ps.སྐོམ་ སྐོམས་ /f.སྐོམ་/imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o].Denominative of:སྐོམ་ «dry» []/m. For a desire to drink to arise when the liquid of the body is depleted To suffer because the wetness within the mouth has dried./n. Compare: skam and skem.

[1]/p.སྐོར་ /ps.བསྐོརད་བསྐོར་ /f.བསྐོར་/imp.སྐོརད་ སྐོར་ /vl./tr./synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁོར་/ch.ex.ཆོས་འཁོར་སོགས་ལྷ་ཁང་དང་རྟེན་ལ་འཁོར་བར་/m. 1. To fill with; to surround, encircle, enclose, besiege; to come again and again; to revolve. 2. To traverse, ride round a thing. 3. To circumambulate To turn round; to turn a wheel; to take a round; to encircle, surround 1. To make something turn around the circumference of a center. 2. To lead, take control. 3. To encircle, surround. 4. To change directions, shift allegiances. 5. To trick, mislead 1. To turn around, rotate. 2. To surround, encircle./n. suggest that skyor is a palatalized version of this verb, however skor has the root vowel o and skyor the root vowel a, so his analysis is unlikely.
[2]/p.སྐོར་ /ps.བསྐོར་ /f.བསྐོར་/imp.སྐོར་ /vl. /int. /vl. /m. To go, wander, roam, loaf To wander, to roam, to move about./n. In Situ's great commentary only bskor and not skor is given.
/p.སྐོལ་ /ps.བསྐོལད་བསྐོལ་ /f.བསྐོལ་/imp.སྐོལད་ སྐོལ་ /vl., /tr/synt. [e.a] /cs.འཁོལ་/ch.ex.ཟ་སོགས་za dang chu.za dang chu sogs/m. To boil.

/p.སྐྱས་ སྐྱ་ /ps.བསྐྱས་ /f.བསྐྱ་/imp.སྐྱོས་ སྐྱས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཞི་དང་རུས་པ་སོགས་ འཕོ་བའི་/m. 1. To carry; convey to a place (a quantity of stones, wood, water, &c.). 2. To change place To move one's residence or dwelling; to migrate, transfer 1. To move, to move from one place to another, to migrate. 2. (archaic) To deliver, convey.
/p.སྐྱག་ རྐྱག་ /ps.བསྐྱོགས་ /f.བསྐྱག་/imp.སྐྱོག་/m. 1.￼To spread, lay out, expand. 2. (in West) To slaughter, murder (Ja)./n. suggests comparison with འགྱག་
/p.སྐྱད་ /ps.བསྐྱད་ /f.བསྐྱད་/imp.སྐྱད་/synt. [e.a] /m. To kill 1. To kill. 2. To compete [Lishi གུར་ཁང་]
སྐྱས་ gives as the present of སྐྱ་

/p.སྐྱི་ /ps.བསྐྱིས་ /f.བསྐྱི་/imp.སྐྱིས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཞན་ལས་གསེར་དངུལ་སོགས་nor sogs/m. To borrow, especially money or goods To lend; to borrow; to give or take something on loan To loan, borrow./n. Certainly the same verb as skyin[].
[1]/p.སྐྱིག་ /ps.བསྐྱིགས་ /f.བསྐྱིག་/imp.སྐྱིགས་/m. To cause to tie, to fasten.
[2]/p.སྐྱིག་(Ja)/m. To hiccup (Ja).
/p.སྐྱིན་ /ps.བསྐྱིན་བསྐྱིནད་ /f.བསྐྱིན་/imp.སྐྱིནད་/den.སྐྱིན་པ་ «loan» []/m. To borrow To lend, to borrow./n. Compare: {skyi}.

/p.སྐྱིལ་ /ps.བསྐྱིལད་ བསྐྱིལ་ /f.བསྐྱིལ་/imp.སྐྱིལད་ སྐྱིལ་ /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྱིལ་ /ch.ex.མཚོ་དནག་ཆུ་སོགས་chu sogs/m. 1. To pen up, shut up; to dam up a river. 2. (Ja) to bend, especially the legs when sitting on the ground after the oriental fashion. To bend in another's leg by a kick from behind; to bend the bow To dam; to store 1. To dam up, to pen up, contain. 2. To keep.

[1]/p.སྐྱུག་ /ps.སྐྱུགས་ /f.སྐྱུག་/imp.སྐྱུགས་ /vl.Denominative of:སྐྱུག་པ་ «vomit, purgative» []/ch.ex.ཀོང་ནད་/m. To vomit, to eject (e.g. blood). 2. To lose color, to stain To vomit; to come out forcefully.

[2]/p.སྐྱུག་ /ps.བསྐྱུགས་ /f.བསྐྱུག་￼/imp.སྐྱུགས་ /vl./tr. /int./synt. [e.a].Denominative of:སྐྱུག་པ་ «vomit, purgative»[]/m. To cause to vomit To release the contents of the viscera from the mouth To vomit, to wretch.

/p.སྐྱུང་  /ps.བསྐྱུངས་  /f.བསྐྱུང་ /imp.སྐྱུངས་  /vl., /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཁེངས་པ་སོགས་nyung du/m. 1. To diminish, reduce. 2. (Ja) (In central Tibet) to leave behind; to lay aside (a task). To reduce or diminish one's prive or voice; to subdue; to give up. 1. To cast off, leave far behind, to abandon and put behind; to give up completely, to discard completely. 2. To lessen (in amount, degree), to reduce (in size, extent) . /ps.བསྐྱུད་ /f.བསྐྱུད་/imp.སྐྱུད་ - /vl. /inv./tr. /int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.སེམས་ལ་brjed bya/m. 1. To forget. 2. To leave off (Ja). 3. To communicate, swallow (Sch.) To forget; to fail to recall (archaic) To forget To forget.

/p.སྐྱུར་ /ps.བསྐྱུརད་བསྐྱུར་ /f.བསྐྱུར་/imp.སྐྱུརད་ སྐྱུར་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྱུར་/ch.ex.བྱ་བ་ངན་པ་སོགས་རྒྱབ་ཏུ་phar la/m. To throw, to cast; to leave off To throw or to cast off, to renounce or give up 1. To throw away, discard (rubbish). 2. To abandon, leave behind (homeland, troubles) 1. (Mental) To give up on, to abandon, to forsake, to go back on something which one has previously adhered to, to leave behind something for something else seen as better. 2. (Physical) To toss off, away, to cast off something which is now seen as rubbish or as useless .

/p.སྐྱེ་ /ps.སྐྱེས་ /f.སྐྱེ་/imp.སྐྱེ་ སྐྱེས་ - /inv./int/synt. [Abs.]. [a.o]./res.skyed (Laufer 1915: 62).Denominative of:སྐྱེ་བ་ «birth», skye bu «person» []/ch.ex.སྲིད་པ་སོགས་སུ་/m. To be born, arise To be born; to come out newly 1. kinds of vegetation having first sprouted a shoot, to develop fruit. 2. To issues from the mother's womb. 3. To mature, rise up like the sprouting of vegetation. 4. To become larger or longer. 5. To arise, occur 1. To be born, to arise, to grow anew. 2. To grow, increase.

[1]/p.སྐྱེང་ སྐྱེངས་ /ps.སྐྱེངས་ /f.སྐྱེང་སྐྱེངས་ /imp.སྐྱེངས་-./inv./int/synt. [a.o] /m. To be ashamed To be ashamed; to be embarrassed To be abashed, embarrassed, circumspect (especially regarding speech) ./n. I could see here two verbs (skyengs, skyengs, skyengs, - ) and (skyeng, skyengs, skyeng, skyengs) the evidence is insufficient to decide.
[2]/p.སྐྱེང་ /ps.བསྐྱེངས་ /f.བསྐྱེང་ /imp.སྐྱེངས་/m. To make shameful or to cause to be ashamed; to belittle; to bring down.

/p.སྐྱེད་ /ps.བསྐྱེད་ /f.བསྐྱེད་/imp.སྐྱེད་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.skye(Laufer 1915: 62), /ch.ex.ཆོ་ག་དངབུ་སོགས་ལྷ་སོགས་དང་སེམས་/m. To procreate, generate, bring forth. give birth to To make progress, to increase, widen.
/p.སྐྱེམ་ /ps.སྐྱེམས་/m. To be thirsty./n. Root given as skyem < skyam < skam.

/p.སྐྱེལད་སྐྱེལ་ /ps.བསྐྱལད་  སེཨེམས to have bskyamdwhich must be in fact bskyald. has bskyal.bskyal. /f.བསྐྱལ་/imp.སྐྱོལད་སྐྱོལ་  /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཏོ་མདོས་སོགས་gnas su/m. 1. To carry, to take away. 2. To send. 3. To risk, to stake (one's life). 4. To use, to employ To deliver a person or thing; to see off, to kiss; to lose; to vow; to accomplish 1. To go from one place to another place accompanying another person in order to show love, to protect, or supervise. 2. To raise a thing from one place to another place. 3. To use, employ. 4. To finish, perfect 1.To escort, to see off. 2. To send, transport, deliver, 3. To do, to apply. 4. To pass, spend (of time)./n. Root given as skyal /n. Compare: འཁྱོལ་
/p.སྐྱེལ་ /ps.བསྐྱེལ་ /f.བསྐྱེལ་/imp.སྐྱོལ་/inv./int. /m. To conduct, accompany.

/p.སྐྱོ་ /ps.སྐྱོ་ /f.སྐྱོ་/imp.སྐྱོ་-./inv./int/synt. [a.o].Denominative of:སྐྱོ་ «grief, sorrow» []/m. To be sad, to be gloomy 1. To be irritated. 2. To be disaffected 1. To be sad, to be miserable. 2. To be fed up with, to be weary of, to be disenchanted with, to have distaste for .

/p.སྐྱོག་ /ps.བསྐྱོགས་ /f.བསྐྱོག་/imp.སྐྱོགས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /m. To turn, to turn away, aside To turn aside, to drive aside 1. To change direction. 2. To bend, make crooked 1. To turn. 2. To move over, to give way.
[1]/p.སྐྱོང་ /ps.སྐྱོང་ /f.སྐྱོང་/int./m. To go on a long road.

[2]/p.སྐྱོང་E /ps.བསྐྱངས་ བསྐྱོངས་ /f.བསྐྱང་/imp.སྐྱོང་(Zeisler 2004: 349).skyongs. /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དྲིན་གྱིས་brtse ba dang drin gyis.drin gyis bon [tshes]B bstan pa sogs/m. To guard; to keep; to defend; to save; to preserve To look after; to nurse, cherish; to take care of; to administer 1. To look after, support, take care of. 2. To supervise, direct, support 1. To sustain, take care of, tend, look after. 2. To protect, guard. 3. To manage, do, hold, control, carry out.
[1]/p.སྐྱོད་ /ps.བསྐྱོད་ /f.བསྐྱོད་/imp.སྐྱོད་-. /vl. /inv./tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གནས་སོགས་དང་རླུང་གིས་/m. To move; to go, pass on To move To move, agitate To move, stir, agitate.
[2]/p.སྐྱོད་ /ps.བསྐྱོད་ /f.བསྐྱོད་/imp.སྐྱོད་ /vl./tr. /int/ch.ex.གོམ་པའི་ཞབས་ཀྱིས་/m. (In West) (Respectful) To go, to walk To cause to go or proceed To go To go.
[1]/p.སྐྱོན་ /ps.སྐྱོནད་ /f.སྐྱོན་/imp.སྐྱོནད་/m. To make defective; to become defective.

[2]/p.སྐྱོནད་ སྐྱོན་ /ps.བསྐྱོན་ བསྐྱོནད་ /f.བསྐྱོན་/imp.སྐྱོནད་ སྐྱོན་ /vl., /tr/synt. [e.a] /cs.zhon, /ch.ex.རྟ་དང་གསལ་ཤིང་སོགས་ལ་rta la.rta la sogs/m. To put astride upon a thing To put on a horse 1. To have mount, place astride. 2. To place on top of. 3. To make (someone) wear, to dress (someone) 1. To place someone on a horse, to put astride. 2. To place above, place upon. 3. (honorific) Equivalent of the auxiliary verb rgyag./n. Compare: gyon, gon
[3]Auxillary:སྐྱོན་/fn.Suffixed to nouns in order to create verbs, very common in the colloquial. In this respect it is the honorific corresponding to rgyag[]. (Honorific) Equivalent to rgyag pa.

/p.སྐྱོབ་ /ps.སྐྱབས་ /f.སྐྱབ་/imp.སྐྱོབས་ /vl. /tr/synt. [Abs. Abl.] (Hahn 1994: 108). [e.a]./cs.ཁྱབ་[Coblin 1986]/ch.ex.ཉེ་པ་སོགས་'jigs pa dnag sdug sngal sogs las.'jigs pa la/m. To protect; to defend, preserve, save To protect, give shelter; to defend, to rescue To help, save from danger To protect./n. Related to the noun skyob «protection, refuge». suggests that this verb is a palatalized version of gab «cover, protect» though he does not account for the voicing difference.

/p.སྐྱོམ་ /ps.བསྐྱམས་ བསྐྱོམས་ /f.བསྐྱམ་ བསྐྱོམ་ /imp.སྐྱོམས་ /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྱོམ་/ch.ex.མཙོ་སོགས་snod sogs/m. (Rare in colloquial) 1. To pour; to pout out, agitate, stir up. 2. (Lex) To give To swish, to stir a liquid; to cause turbulence To stir, agitate (a liquid) To stir, shake.

[1]/p.སྐྱོར་ /ps.བསྐྱར་བསྐྱརད་ /f.བསྐྱར་/imp.སྐྱོརད་ སྐྱོར་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.སླར་ཡང་yang yang/m. To repeat, recite by heart To repeat; to do, make something again; to reproduce, imitate; to recite To read aloud, repeat To repeat, to do over again ./n. lists a verb (skyor, bskyord, bskyar, skyord) which is a conflation of this verb and the following. suggest that skyor is a palatalized version of skor, however skor has the root vowel o and skyor the root vowel a, so his analysis is unlikely.

[2]/p.སྐྱོར་ /ps.བསྐྱོརད་ བསྐྱོར་ /f.བསྐྱོར་/imp.སྐྱོརད་ སྐྱོར་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /m. To hold up, to prop, to paste To support upright; to support from al sides so as to stand; to help, to support 1. To prevent a person or thing from falling down. 2. To help, do, protect To support, prop up, brace.

/p.སྐྲག་ /ps.སྐྲགས་ སྐྲག་ /f.སྐྲག་/imp.སྐྲགས་-./inv./int/synt. [a.o] /m. (nearly always combined with འཇིགས་པ་) To be terrified, frightened, afraid of something To be frightened, to be terrified To become afraid To be afraid./n. Cognate with adjective སྐྲག་ «scary».

/p.སྐྲང་ skrangs. /ps.སྐྲངས་ སྐྲང་￼. /f.སྐྲང་  skrangs /imp.སྐྲངས་ -./inv./tr. /int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To swell To swell, be swollen For the flesh to swell up due to injury to the body or illness To swell up.

/p.སྐྲབ་ /ps.བསྐྲབས་ /f.བསྐྲབ་/imp.སྐྲབས་/synt. [e.a]./cs.འཁྲབ་[]/ch.ex.བྲོ་དང་རྐང་སྟབས་སོགས་/m. To beat the ground with one's feet; to stamp, tread; to dance To cause to dance; to cause to select./n. gives skrab as an archaic word for བྲོ་འཁྲབ་
/p.སྐྲི་ (archaic). (archaic). /ps.བསྐྲིས་ /f.བསྐྲི་/imp.སྐྲིས་ སྐྲི་ /vl./ch.ex.ཁག་/m. To conduct, to send (Cs.) To give, send.

/p.སྐྲུ་ (archaic) /ps.བསྐྲུས་ སྐྲུས་ (see note) /f.བསྐྲུ་/imp.སྐྲུས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཤིང་གི་ཡལ་ག་དང་གཞན་ལ་ཐབས་ཀྱིས་/m. To wait (Sch.); to cut To begfor food, to make a hole by digging or cutting; to hollow out To cut; to deceive 1. To beg. 2. (archaic) To deceive. 3. To cut into pieces.
/p.སྐྲུད་ (archaic)/m.To make another run away by devices./n. Root given as skrud

/p.སྐྲུན་ /ps.བསྐྲུནད་ བསྐྲུན་ /f.བསྐྲུན་/imp.སྐྲུནད་ TDTD (appears to list skund as the imperative, a mistake for སྐྲུནད་ skrun /vl. /tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.མཉུ་གུ་སོག་་[sic]TD.མཉུ་གུ་སོགས་དགེ་རྩ་བསཡེད་པ་/m. To produce To establish, to build; to make 1. To print a book. 2. To make, produce To make, construct, build, invent, produce.
/p.སྐྲེས་ sres()./cs.'dres/m. To mix./n. given as the primary spelling of sre

/p.སྐྲོག་དཀྲོག་ /ps.བསྐྲོགས་སྐྲོགས་ /f.བསྐྲོག་སྐྲོག་/imp.སྐྲོགས་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a]./cs. *[']-ཁྲོག་-[s]/ch.ex.ཞོ་དང་Da ma ru sogs.Dar ma ru sogs/m. To beat (the drum); to churn; to stir ￼(with a rod) Another way to write dkrog. 1. To churn, stir. 2. To beat a drum./n. suggests this verb is onomatopoetic
[2]/p.སྐྲོག་/cs.'drog/m. To rouse, to scare up./n. Root given as s-k-rog < s-'-rog < s-rog ?.
/p.སྐྲོད་ /ps.བསྐྲད་ /f.བསྐྲད་/imp.སྐྲོད་ /vl./tr/synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཏེའུ་དང་བགེགས་སོགས་phyir la/m. To expel, drive out, eject To drive away from a previous location To expel, banish, drive out.
/p.སྐྲོབ་ /ps.བསྐྲབས་ /f.བསྐྲབ་/imp.སྐྲོབས་/ch.ex.ཏི་ཀུ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་
/p.སྐྲོལ་ /ps.བསྐྲོལད་ /f.བསྐྲོལ་/imp.སྐྲོལད་/den.རོལ་ «music» (?) []/m. To cause to make sound; to cause to stir up.
བརྐམ་ give as the present of རྐམ་
/p.བསྐལ་ /ps.བསྐལ་ /f.བསྐལ་/imp.-./inv./int/synt. [a.o] /m. To be cut off by a long distance or period of time To be separated, cut off./n. Undoubtedly a generalization of the past of skeld q.v.
/p.བསྐོན་/cs.ཁོན་ or འཁོན་/m. To get caught, hung up (on a peg)./n. Hypothesized by Chang on colloquial data, see rkon.
ཁང་ gives as a literary alternate of ཁེང་

/p.ཁུག་འཁུགས་ (). /ps.ཁུག་ ཁུགས་ /f.འཁུག་ ཁུག་ /imp.ཁུགས་ - /inv. /tr. /synt. [Abs. ￼￼￼￼￼Obl.]./cs.'gugs/m. To find, get, earn, draw To calm down; to bend down; to fall asleep; to valued; to be worth To be the price of (something) 1. To turn into, to change, to become. 2. To get, to make, to find.

/p.ཁེགས་ ཁེག་ འཁེགས་ /ps.ཁེགས་ /f.ཁེགས་ཁེག་/imp.-./inv./tr. Intransitive /synt. [a.o]./res. འགོག་/m. To obstruct, to close For something to be unable to move because something else is stuffed inside (a pipe, hole &c.) To be obstructed, to stop, to come to halt.

/p.འཁེང་ཁེང་ ཁེངས་ /ps.ཁེངས་ ཁངས་ /f.ཁེངས་ཁེངས་/imp.ཁེངས་-./inv., /int. /synt. [e.a]./res.'geng, /m. To be replete, to be full To be full To fill up the inside To be full./n. suggest that ཁངས་ is a literary variant of ཁེངས་ Compare: also skong, gang, and sgang.
/p.ཁེན་ /ps.ཁེན་ /f.ཁེན་/int., (Skorupski 2001)/m. To lean, to repose on. (erroneously for བཁན་པ་ [sic]) (Sch.) To rest, rely on in order not to collapse (dialect) To lean, to rest against.
/p.འཁེབས་ ཁེབས་ /ps.ཁེབ་ཁེབས་ /f.འཁེབ་ ཁེབས་/imp.ཁེབས་ -./inv./tr. /int./res.'gebs. /m. To cover; to spread over To cover up; to spread over To be able to cover, be able to arrange To be covered.
/p.ཁེར་ /ps.ཁེར་ /f.ཁེར་/int. /m. To make vertical, to extend./n. reports this as similar in meaning to ker to which it is likely a mere orthographic variant of, reflecting an aspirate pronunciation.
/p.ཁོག་/res.'gog/m. To be taken out.

/p.ཁོམ་ ཁོམ་ /ps.ཁོམ་ /f.འཁོམ་ ཁོམ་ /imp.ཁོམས་-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. to have leisure, time to do a thing. 2. to be enabled to do a thing by the absence of external impediments (Schtr.) To have time; to be free; to be free from the worldly activities To not have leisure, time To have time for something.
ཁོལ་ gives as the present of འཁོལ་

/p.ཁྱག་ /ps.ཁྱགས་ཁྱག་ /f.ཁྱག་/imp.ཁྱགས་ ཁྱག་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /m. To undertake, to be surety for [sic] To float on water; to become mentally unsettled or unsteady To endure hardship, to be able to hold up To endure, to be able to lift or hold up something.

/p.ཁྱབ་ /ps.ཁྱབ་ /f.ཁྱབ་/imp.ཁྱབ་-./inv./int. /synt. [e.a]./res.skyob[Coblin 1986]/ch.ex.གཏམ་ཙེགས་དང་ཡུལ་ལ་་/m. To fill, penetrate, embrace; estimate, comprise To cover up, to spread over To spread, cover To cover, to pervade, to include, to spread.
/p.ཁྱོག་ /ps.ཁྱོག་ /f.ཁྱོག་/imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be sustainable, to be borne, to be bearable./n. Compare: འཁྱོག་
/p.ཁྲུལ་ /ps.ཁྲུལ་ /f.ཁྲུལ་/int.:/m. To let fall; to drop (several things at intervals) To fall, drop individually.
/p.ཁྲེམས་ /ps.ཁྲེམས་ /f.ཁྲེམས་/imp.-/inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To water gardens and cultivation; to sprinkle water To be absorbed.
/p.ཁྲེལ་ /ps.ཁྲེལ་ /f.ཁྲེལ་/imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be ashamed; to provoke shame To loose hope, to no longer desire To be embarrassed (by the reproach of another), to be considerate.

/p.ཁྲོ་ འཁྲོ་ /ps.ཁྲོས་ /f.ཁྲོ་ འཁྲོ་ /imp.ཁྲོས་ - /inv./int. /synt. [a.o].Denominative of:ཁྲོ་ «anger»/ch.ex.སྡང་དགྲ་སོགས་ལ་་ ཁྲོ་བོར་ /m. To be angry To get angry; to be filled with anger; to be indignant To be angry, aggressive To go angry, to become angry.

/p.མཁས་ /ps.མཁས་ /f.མཁས་/imp.མཁས་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཆོས་སྲིད་སོགས་ལས་་ /m. To become wise; to become a scholar; cause to be learned To be able, skilled, to have compassion To be learned./n.gives the imperative as མཁས་པར་གྱིས་ implying that there is no imperative.
/p.མཁོ་ /ps.མཁོ་ /f.མཁོ་/imp.མཁོ་ - /inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.འདི་དང་ཕྱི་མ་སོགས་ལ་་/m. To want To necessitate; to become necessary; to be in need To want, to need.

/p.མཁྱུད་ /ps.མཁྱུད་ /f.མཁྱུད་/imp.མཁྱུད་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དོན་ནམ་དཔེ་སོགས་་/m. To keep, to hold, to retain To be secretive, to conceal one's knowledge with ill intention (archaic) To hide (small religious instructions &c.) To conceal, to hide.

/p.མཁྱེནད་ མཁྱེན་  /ps.མཁྱེནད་མཁྱེན་ /f.མཁྱེན་/imp.མཁྱེནད་ མཁྱེན་ /vl./inv./tr., (Skorupski 2001)/int. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དགོངས་ཡུལ་དུ་་/m. To know To know, to understand; to comprehend To know, understand, examine (honorific) To know, to comprehend./n. Root given as མཁྱེན་ < *མཁྱན་ < མཁན་
/p.མཁྲང་ /ps.མཁྲངས་ /f.མཁྲང་/imp.-./inv./ch.ex.བློ་ཤེད་སོགས་/m. hard, solid, compact (Ja).
/p.མཁྲེག་ /ps.མཁྲེགས་ /f.མཁྲེག་/imp.-./inv./ch.ex.སྲ་བའི་་/m. hard, firm (Ja).
/p.མཁྲེན་ /ps.མཁྲེནད་ /f.མཁྲེན་/imp.-ND/inv./ch.ex.ཐུགས་ལ་་

/p.འཁང་ (Denwood 1991: 136). /ps.འཁང་ འཁངས་ (Denwood 1991: 136). /f.འཁང་/imp.འཁངས་ - /inv., ￼/int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To hurt at heart or offend, also to irritate To be unsatisfied, to be discontented or hateful To believe, to not be happy To be resentful, to be spiteful, to bear ill will To recriminate, complain, resist (Denwood 1991: 136)

/p.འཁམ་ འཁམས་ /ps.འཁམས་ /f.འཁམ་ འཁམས་ /imp.འཁམས་ -./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. To sink or fall down senseless; to faint away; to swoon. 2. To take into one's mouth (Sch.) To faint, to become unconscious.
/p.འཁར་ /ps.འཁརད་ འཁར་ /f.འཁར་/imp.འཁརད་ -./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To adhere, to stick to To long for; to crave for, to be greedy; to be impeded To adhere to, to stick to, to be caught on.

/p.འཁལ་  འཁེལ་ (). /ps.བཀལད་ བཀལ་ /f.བཀལ་ དགལ་ /imp.ཁེལད་ འཁལད་ ཁོལ་ འཁོལ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.སྐུད་པ་སོགས་་/m. 1. To spin. 2. (in West) To send; to forward things To spin yard; to make thread To spin wool, cotton, silk &c. into thread To spin./n. Compare: འཁེལ་

/p.འཁུ་(Denwood 1991: 136). /ps.འཁུས་(Denwood 1991: 136). འཁུ་ /f.འཁུ་/imp.འཁུ་ - /inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཞེ་གནག་གིས་་/m. To offend, to vie with, contend (Ja) To be unsatisfied; to hate To bear thoughts of harm 1. To contend with, to vie with, to harm. 2. (archaic) To oppose To oppose, rebel (Denwood 1991: 136)./n. perhaps to be linked with dku.
འཁུགས་  give as the present of ཁུག་

/p.འཁུན་ /ps.འཁུནད་ ཁུནད་ འཁུན་ /f.འཁུན་ ཁུན་ /imp.འཁུན་ འཁུནད་ - /inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཁུར་སོགས་ཀྱིས་མནརད་ཏེ་་/m. To pant, to whisper For a sound to come from the throat because of illness 1. To groan, to moan. 2. To be breathless. 3. To make a guttural sound like the cawing of a pigeon.

/p.འཁུམ་ /ps.ཁུམས་འཁུམ་ND འཁུམས་ /f.འཁུམ་/imp.འཁུམས་ - /inv., /int. /synt. [a.o]./res. skum(Gyurme 1992: ￼259), /m. To shrink To contract, shrink; to be afraid of, to recoil 1. To shrink in size. 2. To measure, be miserly To shrink, contract.

/p.འཁུམས་འཁུམ་ /ps.འཁུམས་ ཁུམས་འཁུམ་ND /f.འཁུམས་འཁུམ་ ཁུམ་ /imp.འཁུམས་ ཁུམས་ - Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/tr. /int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཚིགདོན་སོགས་/m. To comprehend To comprehend, to hear To know, to have an idea of.

/p.འཁུར་ བཀུར་ (in West). /ps.ཁུརད་ ཁུར་ བཀུརད་ /f.ཁུར་ འཁུར་ བཀུར་ /imp.ཁུར་ ཁུརད་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./res. skur/ch.ex.ཁྲེས་པོ་སོགས་་ /m. To carry; to fetch; in convey To carry To carry placed on a person's back or shoulders To carry, to shoulder, to bear.

/p.འཁུལ་ /ps.འཁུལད་འཁུལ་(ལི་ཡུང་ཁྲང་ 1988). /f.འཁུལ་ (ལི་ཡུང་ཁྲང་ 1988)/imp.འཁུལད་ - (ལི་ཡུང་ཁྲང་ 1988)./inv.(ལི་ཡུང་ཁྲང་ 1988)/int. /synt. [a.o]./res.སྐུལ་[Coblin 1986]/m. 1. To subdue, to subject (Nag) (Cs.). 2. To be uneasy about To subdue, to force.
/p.འཁུས་ /ps.བཀུས་ /f.བཀུ་/imp.ཁུས་/m. To extract juice from; to take out juice (archaic) To conceal.
/p.འཁེང་ /ps.འཁེངས་ /f.འཁེང་/imp.-. /inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be frozen, to be congealed.
འཁེབས་ give as present of ཁེབས་

/p.འཁེལ་ ཁེལ་ འགེལ་ /ps.བཀལད་ ཁེལ་ /f.བཀལ་དགལ་འཁལ་ སེཨེམས to read འཁས་ but this is more likely a mistake than the འཁལ་ of. འཁེལ་ཁེལ་/imp.ཁེལད་[], ཁོལད་ - /vl. /inv., /tr. /int. /synt.[Abs.]. [a.o]./res.'gel/ch.ex.ཁྲལ་དང་ཆད་པ་སོགས་་ ཁལ་དང་གཟེར་ལུང་ལ་ སྐུད་པ་སོགས་ /m. To put on, to pack on, to load (འཁེལ་) 1. to load upon; = འཁེལ་བ་ (Ja), 2. reply upon; depend on (ཁེལ་). To be decided, to be confirmed; to strike, hit; to be on the way 1. To strike (e.g. a target with arrow). 2. To decide on the meaning of a belief 1. To be determined. 2. To ￼make contact, to encounter, to coincide with, to endure. 3. To trust.

/p.འཁོ་ /ps.འཁོས་(Zeisler 2004: 454).ཁོས་(Zeisler 2004: 454). /f.དགོས་(see note)/m. To wish, to want, to think useful, serviceable, necessary (Ja)./n. Compare: ཁོས་པ་ «wanted, wished for», compare also མཁོ་ «to be desirable, necessary» མཁོས་ཕུབ་ «fancy for something». dgos «to need» may perhaps be related as the future stem (Zeisler 2004: 454 n. 138).

/p.འཁོང་ /ps.འཁོང་ /f.འཁོང་/int. /m. To draw in one's limbs; to sit in a cowering position, to squat; to hide one's self 1. To be unsatisfiedly unhappy. 2. To remain with the body's limbs contracted. 3. (mdo smad dialect for sgong1) To make into a ball (barley flower &c.) (archaic) To be disheartened./n. Compare: bkong1 and འགོང་

/p.འཁོད་ /ps.འཁོད་ ཁོད་ /f.འཁོད་/imp.འཁོད་ ཁོད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /tr. /synt. [a.o]./res.'god/ch.ex.གདན་སོགས་ལ་་/m. To sit, to dwell, to live; to be set down To be registered; to sit down on a throne; to be enthroned; to become a leader; to be in line To stay in one's place 1. To be placed, to be present, to be situated. 2. To be established, to be set down, to be recorded, to be labeled./n.(Uray 1972: 19) connects this verb with མཁོས་/ཁོས་/ཁོད་ «institution, administration, settlement of the state» along with the verbs, སྐོ་ and འགོད་

[1]/p.བཀོན་འཁོན་ /ps.བཀོནད་ /f.བཀོན་/imp.བཀོནད་ ཀོནད་ ཁོནད་ /vl. /tr. (Skorupski 2001)./cs. འཁོན་[2][]/ch.ex.གནོད་པ་སོགས་ logs la /m. To create enmity; to disturb a friendly relation or to cause disunion To threaten, menace (archaic) To bear a grudge, to harbor revenge.

[2]/p.འཁོན་ /ps.ཁོནད་ ཁོན་འཁོན་ /f.འཁོན་/imp.འཁོན་ ཁོནད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [Abs. Ass.]./res. འཁོན་[1][]/ch.ex.གཞན་དང་་/m. To bear a grudge or ill will against a person; to be dissatisfied with a thing; to be malicious, spiteful To be revengeful, spiteful, hateful 1. To bear enmity, hostility. 2. To be impeded, to be obstructed./n. suggests based on colloquial data a verb *འཁོན་ which means «to get caught, or hung up» see note at skon, and rkon.
/p.འཁོབས་ འཁོབ་  /ps.འཁོབས་ འཁོབ་ /f.འཁོབ་/imp.-/inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be startled, agitated, alarmed (Ja) To be stiff due to cold To be stiff, rigid ￼.
འཁོམས་ gives as the present of ཁོམ་

/p.འཁོརད་ འཁོར་  /ps.འཁོརད་ འཁོར་ /f.འཁོར་/imp.འཁོར་ འཁོརད་ -./inv., /int. /synt. [a.o]./res.skor/ch.ex.ལས་ཉོན་གྱིས་འཁོར་བར་་/m. 1. To turn round, circumambulate. 2. To be formed, perfected. To rotate or turn round 1. To turn at a hub. 2. To change direction. 3. To come, to gather To revolve, to rotate, to spin, to go around, to elapse (of time)./n. Compare: the noun sgor mo 'round, a circle, globe'.

[1]/p.འཁོལ་ ཁོལ་ /ps.ཁོལ་ /f.འཁོལ་/imp.ཁོལད་ -/inv./int. /synt. [Abs.]. [a.o]./res.skol/m. (in Medicine) To boil To be boiling, to feel anxiety or to be agitated, to be active in service, to be an obedient servant For bubbles to arise from within a liquid which has arrived at a certain temperature To boil, be boiled.

[2]/p.འཁོལ་ /ps.བཀོལད་ བཀོལ་ /f.བཀོལ་ དགོལ་ /imp.ཁོལ་ ཁོལད་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཡོག་སོགས་སུ་་ /m. 1. To make a person a slave; to bind as a servant, to cause to serve one. 2. To become insensible, to be asleep; to get benumbed in reference to the limbs (Sch.) To use as a servant; to make somebody serve; to use To use To take into service, to assign someone, to use.

[3]/p.བཀོལ་འཁོལ་ /ps.བཀོལད་བཀོལ་ /f.བཀོལ་ དགོལ་ /imp.བཀོལད་ ཁོལ་ ཁོལད་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ལོགས་དང་ཟུར་དུ་ zur du las 'am /m. To save; to spare; to enjoy with moderation (Cs.) To isolate, to keep separately To separate apart, put aside To select, set aside, single out, separate.

/p.འཁྱག་ /ps.འཁྱགས་ ཁྱགས་ /f.འཁྱག་ /imp.-. འཁྱགས་ Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.གྲང་བའི་་/m. To freeze, coagulate, feel cold To freeze or become very cold, to be chilled To cool To be cold, to freeze.

/p.འཁྱམ་ /ps.འཁྱམས་ /f.འཁྱམ་/imp.ཁྱམས་ འཁྱམས་ - འཁྱོམས་Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:. /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.འཁོར་བ་སོགས་སུ་་/m. To rove, to wander To wander; to ramble To go here and there without a definite goal To wander, to roam, to travel aimlessly.

/p.འཁྱར་ /ps.འཁྱརད་ ཁྱར་ འཁྱར་ /f.འཁྱར་/imp.འཁྱར་ ཁྱརད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.གཞན་དུ་་/m. To err, to go astray To roam; to wander; to stray To let out a secret To be dislocated, to stray, to be dispersed, to be missing./n. Root given as འཁྱར་ < འཁོར་ 'turn' (?).
[1]/p.འཁྱལ་ /ps.བཀྱལད་ /f.བཀྱལ་/imp.ཀྱལད་ འཁྱལད་/ch.ex.དོན་མེད་པའི་ངག་སོགས་་/m. To talk nonsense, to gossip or drivel.

For earlier and later words to not be connected, for earlier and later to not be connected. 2. To move away from an earlier position To lapse, to lose control, to go astray./n. Compare: the nouns rkyal ka, and kyal ka 'a joke, jest, trick'.

[1]/p.འཁྱིག་ འཁྱིགས་  /ps.བཀྱིགས་ /f.བཀྱིག་/imp.ཁྱིགས་ འཁྱིགས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.རྐང་ལག་སོགས་་ thag pas /m. To bind, to take prisoner; (in Central Tibet) to strangle, suffocate To bind; to fasten or tie; to truss up To restrain men, livestock &c. with a rope To tie, bind.

/p.འཁྱིགས་(Ja). /m. To comprise, encompass (Ja).
/p.འཁྱིད་ (archaic). /m. To turn, roll (one's eyes); to draw out; strain; to roll, revolve.
/p.འཁྱིམས་ /ps.འཁྱིམས་ /f.འཁྱིམས་/imp.འཁྱིམས་/int. /ch.ex.ཉི་ཟླ་སོགས་་/m. To be encircled with a halo, like the sun and moon To seep out from./n. Compare: 'gyim pa 'circumference'.
/p.འཁྱིར་ འཁྱིརད་ /ps.ཁྱིར་ འཁྱིར་ /f.འཁྱིར་/imp.ཁྱིར་ -./inv./tr. /int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To turn around To wind round; to move in a circle; to circle To rotate a parasol To rotate, spin.

To wind; to twist; to whirl around To be collected or to be stored; to accumulate 1. To be bent like the pattern of a conch shell. 2. For liquids (water &c.) to gather 1. To be absorbed. 2. To whirl around, to twist, to coil up, to curl up, to spiral.
འཁྱུ་ gives as the present of འཁྱུས་

/p.འཁྱུད་ /ps.འཁྱུད་ ཁྱུད་ /f.འཁྱུད་/imp.འཁྱུད་ ཁྱུད་ Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:. /vl. /int. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཕན་ཚུན་/m. 1. To embrace. 2. To glide in or into. 3. To be able To embrace or hug; to encompass; to coil up; to surround or to encircle; to have great faith or interest in some one or some thing 1. Tug, to embrace. 2. To engage in sexual intercourse.

/p.འཁྱུར་ འཁྱུརད་ /ps.ཁྱུར་ འཁྱུར་ /f.འཁྱུར་/imp.ཁྱུརད་ -./inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.skyur./m. 1. To be separated, divorced (Cs.); to stop; to put an end to. 2. To be deserted (Ja) To be transferred To be transferred, to be assigned.

/p.འཁྱུ་ འཁྱུས་ (archaic) /ps.འཁྱུས་ ཁྱུས་ /f.འཁྱུ་ འཁྱུས་ /imp.ཁྱུས་-TK./inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.dkyu[]/m. To run away (an archaic equivalent of 'bros) To flee To run away, to flee./n.ND lists another verb འཁྱུས་ དཀྱུས་ དཀྱུ་ དཀྱུས་ with /ch.ex. བྲོས་པའི་ which is clearly a confusion between this verb and དཀྱུ་ compare དཀྱུ་
/p.འཁྱེག་ /ps.བཀྱེག་ /f.འགྱེག་/imp.ཁྱོག་/ch.ex.ཡར་ལ་་
/p.འཁྱེད་ /ps.ཁྱེད་/res.'gyed/m. 1. To be sufficient, to suffice, to be enough; to hold out. 2. (Central Dialect) To gain (a lawsuit); to be acquitted (Ja).

/p.འཁྱེར་ /ps.ཁྱེརད་ ཁྱེར་ /f.ཁྱེར་ འཁྱེར་ /imp.ཁྱེར་ ཁྱེརད་ འཁྱེརད་ /vl., /int. /tr. /synt. [e.a]. /ch.ex.རྫས་སོགས་གཞན་དུ་ lag tu /m. To carry away, to take away To carry, to take away, to bring To carry, to take away.
/p.འཁྱེལ་ /m. (in Ladakh) To hit, to strike.

/p.འཁྱོག་ /ps.ཁྱོག་ འཁྱོག་ འཁྱོགས་ /f.འཁྱོག་/imp.ཁྱོག་ འཁྱོགས་ - /vl. /inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. To lift; lift up. 2. To carry, to bring To be crooked; to become crooked, to twist To be bent, to be crooked, to sway, to curve.

To continue without interruption. 2. To arrive at a good or complete [state]. 3. To be able. 4. To enunciate, use good diction To continue, to conclude.

/p.འཁྱོམ་ /ps.འཁྱོམས་ /f.འཁྱོམ་/imp.￼ཁྱོམས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o]./res.skyomBeyer incorrectly gives འཁྱོ་ [sic] 'reel, stagger' for འཁྱོམ་ with causative skyom 'shake, agitate'., /ch.ex.ས་དང་སེམས་སོགས་/m. (in Central Tibet) To reel, stagger To be aroused, to be agitated, to be disturbed. 2. To sway, to roll, to rock.

/p.འཁྱོར་ /ps.འཁྱོར་ /f.འཁྱོར་/imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be unsteady; to miss, fail, not to hit (Cs.); to reel, stager from intoxication To be unsteady, to stagger, to totter./n. Root given as འཁྱོར་ < འཁོར་ 'turn'

/p.འཁྱོལ་ འཁྱོལད་ /ps.འཁྱོལད་ ཁྱོལ་ འཁྱོལ་ /f.འཁྱོལ་/imp.འཁྱོལད་ ཁྱོལད་ -./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཉམས་ལེན་སོགས་ཚད་དུ་/m. To be carried, to be bought To reach one's destination; to complete one's life To be concluded, to be finished, to reach a goal /n. suggests comparison with skyel

/p.འཁྲ་ /ps.འཁྲས་ (probably) /f.འཁྲ་/imp.འཁྲས་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.རྟེན་གནས་སོགས་ལ་/m. To lean to; to incline toward (Cs.) To crave for; to be impeded (archaic) To be attached, to stay in one place, to depend on.

[1]/p.འཁྲབ་ /ps.བཀྲབ་སྐྲབ་ བཀྲབས. /f.བཀྲབ་ dkrab/imp.འཁྲབས་ ཁྲོབས་ /vl. /tr./res.skrab[].Denominative of:འཁྲབ་མ་'flail, fan' []/m. 1. To strike; to beat (in regular, strokes as in swimming and rowing). 2. To winnow, to fan. 3. To blink, twinkle, wink with the eyes. To jest, joke. 5. To leap, jump. 6. To scoop out; to bail out To select; to move legs, eyes etc. to dance To thresh or winnow chaff from grain with a flail or fan.
[2]/p.འཁྲབ་ /ps.འཁྲབས་ འཁྲབ་ /f.འཁྲབ་/imp.༤་ ཁྲོབས་ འཁྲོབས་ /vl., /tr. /synt. [e.a] /res.skrab[]/ch.ex.བྲོ་གར་སོགས་/m. To dance To perform, to stage, to beat, to stamp.

/p.འགུལ་ /ps.འགུལད་ འགུལ་ /f.འགུལ་/imp.འགུལ་འགུལད་-Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgul, /ch.ex.ས་སོགས་/m. To move, quake, shake To become unsteady, to move To move apart from a previous location, to change a previous characteristic or location To move, to shake
འགེགས་  give as a present of འགོག་

/p.འགེང་  'gengs /ps.བཀང་ བཀངས་ /f.དགང་ བཀང་ /imp.ཁེངས་KYT. ཁོང་ ཁོངས་ གེངས་ འགེངས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.gang, /cs.ཁེང་ /ch.ex.བུམ་བཆུས་ སྣོད་སོགས་(འགེང་ བཀང་ བཀང་ ཁོངས་) མདའ་(འགེངས་ བཀངས་ བཀང་ གེངས་) བུམ་པ་ལྟ་བུ་ཆུ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་(འགེངས་ བཁང་ དགང་ ཁོངས་). སྣོད་དང་གཞུ་སོགས་/m. To fill up, to satiate To fill up; to fulfill; to pull the string of a bow with an arrow for shooting 1. To fill. 2. To draw a bow string./n. Compare: སྐོང་ and ཁེང་

/p.འགེབས་ འགེབ་  /ps.བཀབ་ /f.དགབ་ བགབ་/imp.ཁོབས་ ཁོབ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.ཁེབས་ gab /res.sgab, [Coblin 1986]Denominative of:ཁེབས་ «a cover»[]/ch.ex.ན་བཟའ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་ གོས་དང་དྲེབས་སོགས་ ?, གོས་དང་ཁེབས་སོགས་/m. To cover up, to put on; to conceal To cause to spread over; to cover; to put on, to wear 1. To become obscure from darkness. 2. To hide, make secret To conceal, to cover.
/p.འགེམ་ འགེམས་ /ps.འགེམས་ /f.འགེམ་ འགེམས་/imp.འགེམས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To defeat, subdue, overcome To crush.
འགེར་ gives as the present of དགར་

/p.འགེལ་ /ps.ཀལ་ བཀལད་ བཀལ. /f.དགལ་/imp.ཁོལ་ ཁོལད་ འགེལད. /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./res. sgal[Coblin 1986] /cs.འཁེལ་/ch.ex.ཁལ་དང་ཁྲལ་སོགས་/m. To load, to lay on a burden, to impose tax or rent, to commission; to put, to place on, over; to impose a fine; to give punishment To give responsibilities, to load; to impose, lay a tax, to levy a tax 1. To burden cattle with a load. 2. To trust, hope. 3. For someone of high rank to impose a certain task or aim to be accomplished upon person of lower rank 1. To impose, to burden. 2. To load a pack animal. 3. to hang. 4. To trust, to entrust.
འགེས་ gives as the present of དགས་ or འགས་

/p.འགོ་ /ps.འགོས་ གོས་ /f.འགོ་/imp.གོས་ འགོས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /res.sgo, /ch.ex.ལུས་ལྷ་དང་སྐྱོན་སོགས་/m. To stain, lose color, dirty sully To be infected; to be covered For one thing to stick to or contaminate another thing 1. To catch (an illness), to be infected. 2. To be stained, to be sullied, to have a stain or substance stick to oneself.

[1]/p.འགོག་ འགོགས་ འགེགས་ /ps.བཀག་ /f.དགག་ དགགས་/imp.ཁོགས་ ཁོག་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /cs.'gag, /cs.ཁེགས་/ch.ex.གཞན་གྱི་གྲུབ་མཐའ་སོགས་ grub mtha' dang rgol ngan sogs, lam sogs dgagbya /m. To prevent; to avert unfortunate events, as danger, to suppress, drive back, expel To hinder, obstruct, keep back or in To block, obstruct; to stop, hinder; limit 1. To obstruct, to block, to interrupt. 2. To resist, to oppose./n. Compare: bgag.

[2]/p.དགོག་ འགོག་ དགོགས་ /ps.བཀོགས་ བཀོག་ /f.བཀོག་ དགོག་/imp.གོག་ ཁོག་ ཁོགས་ /vl. /tr. /cs.gog. ཁོག་ /ch.ex.རྩ་བ་སོགས་ rtsa ba nas/m. 1. To take away forcibly; to snatch, take away, pull out. 2. To take off a cover, lid To detach from; to pull out; to extract; to extirpate 1. For something which adheres together to separate apart. 2. To pluck, comb 1. To extract, to pull out. 2. To detach, to scrape off, to peel off.
འགོགས་ gives as the present of འགོག༡་

/p.འགོང་ /ps.བཀོང་ འགོངས་ /f.འགོང་/imp.འགོངས་ -./inv./int. /m. To bewitch, enchant, pass over, get the better of. (the past tense bkong in compounds means 'threat') To be trespassed or violated; to be disgraced; to be afraid of 1. To obtain release from entrapment. 2. To surpass, exceed (archaic) 1. To be intimidated, to be afraid, to be oppressed. 2. To transgress. 3. To rival, to get the better of. 4. To demean, to put down. 5. To exceed, to go beyond. 6. To be released, to escape./n. Compare: བཀོང་1 and འཁོང་

/p.འགོད་ དགོད་ /ps.བགོད་KY, ￼འགོད་KYTZ, བཀོད /f.དགོད་ འཁོད་/imp.ཁོད་ Z (see note) འཁོད་C. 'god /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs. འཁོད་'go/ch.ex.གནས་སུ་ tshom bu dang yi ger sogs su('god), gral dang gnas su(dgod) rgyan dang bde dang bral sogs/m. 1. To design, project, plan; to found, establish, lay out; to fix, put ('god) To build, arrange, plan (bkod) To register, make a record; to coronate, enthrone; to make peace; to put a signature or seal on 1. To insert, to establish, to put, to secure. to rectify. 2. To design, to formulate, to plan out, to build, to lay out. 3. To write, to sign, to record, to document./n. Root given as *go+d./n.Z has an erasure of one character i.e. འཁོད་ may have been the original reading. suggests that 'god functions as a causative of 'go in Lhasa dialect. (Uray 1972: 19) connects this verb with མཁོས་/ཁོས་/ཁོད་ 'institution, administration, settlement of the state' along with the verbs, sko and འཁོད་ (Takeuchi 1990: 175) suggests that the noun god 'order to execute' is derived from the intransitive perfect form of this verb.

/p.གོམ་LZའགོམ་ བགོམ་ {bgoms}. /ps.བགོམས་ /f.བགོམད་LZབགོམ་/imp.འགོམ་LZ- གོམས་ བགོམས./inv.ND /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.རྐང་པ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་ gom pa, gom pas/m. To walk, step, stride, pace (bgom) 1. To tread. 2. (Acc. Sch. = 'ges, 'gum) To pass over, = 'gro('gom) To walk; to pace To pass thither from above To walk over, to cross over, to pass over.
[1]/p.བགོར་ འགོར་ /ps.བགོརད་བགོར་ /f.བགོར་/imp.འགོརད་ བགོར་ /vl. /tr. /cs. 'gor2/m. To linger, loiter in the way; delay To delay; to detain To make time pass To take [time], to elapse, to delay.
[2]/p.འགོར་ /ps.འགོརད་ འགོར་ /f.འགོར་/imp.འགོརད་ -./inv., /int. /synt. [Abs.]./res.'gor1/ch.ex.དུས་དང་ལམ་སོགས་སུ་/m. To tarry, linger, loiter To be delayed; to be late To take time, to be delayed.
འགོལ་CDgives as the present of གོལ་
འགོལད་gives as the present of གོལ་
/p.འགྱག་ /ps.གྱགས་ /f.གྱག་/imp.འགྱགས་/m. To be sold, ￼spend, expended (Cs.) To lose, to destroy./n. suggests comparison with skyag

/p.འགྱང་ /ps.འགྱངས་ /f.འགྱང་/imp.འགྱངས་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res. 'gyangs. sgyang []/m. To be delayed, postponed, farthest [sic] To be delayed; to be late For time to pass To delay, to postpone, to put off.
/p.འགྱངས་ བགྱང་ /ps.བགྱངས་brgyangs. /f.བགྱང་/imp.འགྱངས་བགྱོངས་ /vl. /tr./cs.'gyang/ch.ex.དུས་དང་ཡུན་སོགས་/m. To delay To cause a delay To postpone, delay./n. Compare: sgyang
/p.འགྱས་ /ps.གྱས་ /f.གྱ་/imp.གྱོས་/m. To decay; to diminish.

/p.འགྱིང་ /ps.འགྱིངས་ འགྱིང་ /f.འགྱིང་/imp.འགྱིང་ འགྱིངས་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:. /vl. /int./res.sgying/ch.ex.ཉམས་ཀྱིས་/m. 1. To assume air or appearance of greatness; to sit lifting up in the manner of a lion. 2. To look haughtily; to look down upon; to slight a person To assume a posture, to pose To put on airs, to act haughtily or arrogantly.

/p.འགྱུ་ /ps.འགྱུས་ /f.འགྱུ་/imp.འགྱུ་ འགྱུས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /ch.ex.དུས་ཚེ་སོགས་ལ་/m. To move quickly to and fro (e.g. lightning, a mirage, the mind) To focus one's mind on an object; to scatter from the intended object of meditation; to form the limbs of a child in the womb 1. To quiver back and forth. 2. To be mentally distracted To move /n. Compare: rgyu

/p.འགྱུར་ འགྱུརད་ - (see note). /ps.གྱུརད་གྱུར་འགྱུར, (see note). /f.འགྱུར་/imp.འགྱུར་གྱུརད་-Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o] (Goldstein 1991: 130)/res.sgyur, /m. 1. To become; to grow, increase, change. 2. (Annexed to an infinitive may denote either the perfect or future tense, the context decides in every instance how it is to be understood) To change, become For an essence, ingredient, circumstance &c. to arise as different from before 1. To change, alter. 2. To turn into, become./n. gives two verbs འགྱུར་ གྱུར་ འགྱུར་ - and འགྱུར་ འགྱུར་ འགྱུར་ -, just like does. However for the two definitions are the same. lists འགྱུར་ འགྱུར་ འགཡུར༾།་-།་ཨནད་-།་གྱུར་ འགྱུར་ - as ￼two verbs the second immediatley following the first in his verb tables. However in the body of the dictionary under 'gyur the first definition is listed without verb stems. The second definition is listed with the stems: འགྱུར་ གྱུར་ འགྱུར་ - with the definition 'to be established, or arise different than before'. (Li yung khrang 1988) which is supposed to be an excerpt of verb material form is exactly the same but lists defintion one with the stems: འགྱུར་ འགྱུར་ འགྱུར་ -. also distinguishes two verbs [].
[1]འགྱེ་ give as the present of འགྱེས་
[2]འགྱེ་ gives as the present of འགྱེད༡་

[1]/p.འགྱེ་ འགྱེད་ /ps.བཀྱེས་ བགྱེས་བཀྱེ. /f.བཀྱེ་ དགྱེ་ དགྱེད/imp.བཀྱེ་ ཀྱེས་ ཁྱེས་  'gyed. ཁྱེ་ /vl. /tr. (def. 1)/synt. [e.a]./cs.'gyes.འཁྱེད་ (Coblin 1986), /ch.ex.འོད་ཟེར་སོགས་ sprul pa 'od sbyin /m. 1. To divide, to scatter, disperse. 2. To institute, set going. 3. To give an entertainment, banquet To focus rays; to send; to distribute; to fight a war 1. To deploy (troops in battle). 2. To apply paint, varnish.3. To mutually fight. 4. To give, having divided into pieces. 5. To give off, radiant light 1. To send, to dispatch. 2. To emit. 3. To display, to send forth. 4. To dispute. 5. To give.
[2]/p.འགྱེད་ དགྱེད་ /ps.བཀྱེད་ /f.བགྱེད་ དགྱེད་/imp.ཁྱེད་ /vl. /tr. /m. To stretch, prolong.
[3]/p.འགྱེད་ /ps.འགྱེད་ /f.འགྱེད་/imp.འགྱེད་/ch.ex.འགྱེད་སྟོན་སོགས་/n. perhaps to be connected with 'gyed1

/p.འགྱེརད་ འགྱེར་ /ps.གྱེར་ /f.འགྱེར་/imp.གྱེརད་/synt. [e.a] /m. To drop, or let fall; to throw down; to quit, abandon, throw away (Sch.) To give up; to abandon (archaic) 1. To get rid of, hide away. 2. To separate, break a connection (archaic) To renounce, to abandon.

/p.འགྱེལ་ /ps.འགྱེལད་ འགྱེལ་གྱེལ /f.འགྱེལ་/imp.འགྱེལ་ - གྱེལ་/inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgyel, /ch.ex.ས་ལ་/m. To fall; to tumble down (for a person or upright thing) To lie horizontally To fall, to collapse./n. Root given as gyel < *gyal < gal

/p.འགྱེ་འགྱེས་ /ps.གྱེས་ འགྱེས་ /f.འགྱེས་འགྱེ་/imp.གྱེས་ གྱེད་ - /vl. /inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.'gyed, [Coblin 1986]/ch.ex.སོ་སོར་/m. 1. To be dispersed; to be divided. 2. To issue, proceed, spread, branch from To become separate; to disperse; to be divorced 1. To separate, place apart To be separated, to separate, to split./n. Root given as gye < *gya < *ga cf. 'gas.
/p.འགྱོག་ /ps.འགྱགས་ བཀྱགས་ /f.འགྱོག་ བཀྱག་/imp.ཆོགས་ ཁྱོགས་ ཁྱོག་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a], /ch.ex.མགྲོན་འགྲུལ་རྣམས་ /m. To ascend To lift, hold a thingup To raise, to lift, to support.

/p.འགྱོད་ /ps.འགྱོད་ /f.འགྱོད་/imp.འགྱོད་ - /inv./int. /m. To repent; to grieve for. To lament, relent (not only for bad, but also for good actions, when the latter are attended with disadvantages) To repent; to feel sorry; to befall of regret To mentally suffer latter on account of an action previously done To regret, to fell remorse, to feel sorry.
འགྲགས་ gives as a present of གྲགས༡་ and གྲགས༢་
/p.འགྲང་ /ps.འགྲངས་ /f.འགྲང་/imp.འགྲང་ འགྲངས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /ch.ex.ཟས་སོགས་ཀྱིས་/m. To satisfy with food; to satiate To be full (after meals) To be sated, satiated, to be full.
[2]འགྲང་ gives as the present of བགྲང་
འགྲད་ give as the present of བགྲད་

/p.འགྲན་ /ps.འགྲནད་ འགྲན་ /f.འགྲན་/imp.འགྲན་ འགྲནད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/tr. /res.sgrun/ch.ex.ཕན་ཚུན་རྩལ་སོགས་/m. To vie with, contend with; to strive (for victory) To compete, to challenge To contest for victory To rival, to compete, to contest, to hold a test.
/p.འགྲམས་ /ps.གྲམ་ འགྲམས་ /f.འགྲམ་ འགྲམ་/imp.གྲམས་ -./inv./int. /m. To spread over To be spread out, dispersed, scattered To pervade, to diffuse, to be agitated./n. Compare: gram and 'grem

/p.འགྲས་ /ps.འགྲས་ /f.འགྲས་/imp.འགྲས་ -/inv./int. /ch.ex.དགྲ་སོགས་དང་/m. To hate, to bear ill-will, to have spite against To have spite; to hate For the thought of fighting against an enemy to arise To come to hate, to dislike./n. related to noun dgra 'enemy'.

/p.འགྲིག་ /ps.འགྲིགས་ /f.འགྲིག་/imp.འགྲིགས་ འགྲིགས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o]./cs. འཁྲིག་/res.sgrig, /ch.ex.རྟེན་འབྲེལ་སོགས་/m. To suit, agree, correspond; to be right To be suitable; to be fitting; to be ok 1. To agree, accord, be in harmony. 2. To be appropriate, suitable 1. To suit, to be suitable. 2. To make harmonious, to reconcile.

/p.འགྲིབ་ /ps.གྲིབ་(Zeisler 2004: 462).'grib. 'gribs. /f.འགྲིབ་/imp.འགྲིབས་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgrib/m. 1. To grow dim; to get dark (Cs.) 2. To grow less, to decrease, to be diminished, to decay To be diminished; to decay; to become smaller; to be reduced To become smaller, to become fewer 1. To decrease, to decline. 2. To grow dim, to be covered to set, to disappear./n. suggests comparison with rab rib 'mist, dimness'.

/p.འགྲིམ་ /ps.འགྲིམས་ /f.འགྲིམ་/imp.གྲིམས་ འགྲིམས་ /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཟ་ཏུགས་དང་ཆོས་གྲྭ་སོགས་/m. To march about, perambulate; to rove or stroll about; walk round To wander from place to place; to travel widely, to advance through monastic life, &c. 1. To go to many places. 2. To link from one thing to another To travel, to journey, to wander, to undergo, to attend.

/p.འགྲིལ་ འགྲིལད་ /ps.གྲིལ་ འགྲིལ་ /f.འགྲིལ་/imp.གྲིལད་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgril, (Rona-Tas 1978: 359), /m. 1. To be twisted or wrapped round, to be collected, concentrated; to flock or crowd together. 2. To be turned, rounded, made circular or cylindrical. 3. To fall, drop down (for འཁྲིལ་ ￼Sch.) To roll up; to snowball 1. To twist, turn. 2. (according to some dag yig 'spelling primers') To collect together, to wrap in 1. To be rolled up, to recoil, to be condensed, to be assembled. 2. To roll down./n. Root given as ril (Rona-Tas 1978: 359), /n. (Rona-Tas 1978: 359) calls 'dril 'to be turned, rolled round, twisted into a thing.' the 'passive' of this verb, in addition he suggests a connection to the adjective hril po 'round, globular, close, dense' and the noun ril ba 'scroll'. similarly suggests comparision with ril po 'round'.
འགྲུ་ gives as the present of འགྲུས་
འགྲུང་ gives as the present of བགྲུང་

/p.འགྲུབ་ འགྲུབས་ /ps.གྲུབ་ /f.འགྲུབ་/imp.འགྲུབ་ གྲུབས་ -Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgrub.Denominative of:གྲབས་ «preparation» (Simon 1971: 474)/ch.ex.བསམ་དོན་སོགས་/m. (Situ 69) To be accomplished; to be made ready, to be finished To be accomplished 1. To become, arise. 2. To exist, stay. 3. To know, understand To become accomplished, to be made, to be fulfilled, to be completed.

/p.འགྲུམ་འགྲུམས་གྲུམས་ {grum}. drum (). /ps.གྲུམས་ /f.འགྲུམ་གྲུམས་ གྲུམ. /imp.གྲུམས་-./inv./int. /m. To pinch, nip off (the point of a thing); to cut off; to prime, lop, clip the wings (Cs.) To be broken or cracked To break into many pieces 1. To be broken, to be damaged. 2. To be exhausted, to be worn out.

/p.འགྲུལ་ /ps.འགྲུལད་ འགྲུལ་ /f.འགྲུལ་/imp.འགྲུལད་ -./inv./int./cs. འཁྲུལ་/m. 1. To walk; to pass; to ravel. 2. Fig. To walk, to live, act, or behave. 3. To pass as good; to be current (of coins) To journey; to go To travel, to tour, to take a trip.
/p.འགྲུས་ འགྲུ་ /ps.འགྲུས་གྲུས་ /f.འགྲུས་/imp.འགྲུས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.ཆོས་ཕྱོགས་ལ་/m. To bestow pains upon a thing To persevere, to be diligent.

/p.འགྲེ་ /ps.འགྲེས་ /f.འགྲེ་/imp.འགྲེས་ -. /vl. ND /inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgre/ch.ex.སྔ་ཕྱི་ rigs/m. To roll one's self To apply a same ￼reasoning; to adjust one's sleeping position 1. To turn over the body while lying down. 2. To use previous reasoning to consider an new topic 1. To be collated, to be juxtaposed, to be mixed. 2. To toss and turn. 3. (archaic) To move.

/p.འགྲེང་ /ps.འགྲེངས་ འགྲེང་ /f.འགྲེང་/imp.གྲེངས་ -. འགྲེངས་Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:. /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o]./res.sgreng,, [Coblin 1986], /ch.ex.གྱེན་དངལུས་སོགས་/m. To stand To rise up; to get up To stand up, to rise up.
འགྲེད་ , (). give as a present of འདྲེད་

[1]/p.འགྲེམ་ 'grems,  /ps.བཀྲམ་ /f.དགྲམ་/imp.ཁྲོམས་ཁྲེམས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.gram/ch.ex.རྒྱན་དར་སོགས་ chu dang gcal du/m. To spread (as of grain, for drying) To scatter; to spread out To spread, to lay out many things To be spread out, to lay out, to distribute.
[2]/p.འགྲེམ་ /ps.འགྲེམས་ /f.འགྲེམ་/imp.གྲེམས་/ch.ex.ཆབ་སོགས་

[1]/p.འགྲེལ་ /ps.བཀྲལད་ བཀྲལ་ /f.དགྲོལ་ དགྲལ་ བཀྲལ/imp.འགྲེལད་ ཁྲོལད་ ཁྲོལ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཞུང་ཚིག་སོགས་ དགོངས་ལ་ཁྱལ་དང་འགྲེལ་ དགོངས་ལ་ཁྱལ་དང་འགྲེལ་པ་/m. 1. To beg, supplicate. 2. To put in, arrange. 3. To explain, comment upon To classify; to elucidate meaning; to explain in detail To comment on, to elucidate the difficult points of a text.
[2]/p.འགྲེལ་ /ps.འགྲེལ་

/p.འགྲོ་ /ps.སོང་ འགྲོ་ཕྱིནད་ཕྱིན་ /f.འགྲོ་/imp.སོང་ རྒྱུ་ (Denwood 1999) /vl., (Goldstein 1991: 93)/int. (Goldstein 1991: 93)/synt. [a.o] /m. To go, to live To go, to move 1. To go, to proceed, to set off, to move. 2. To be acceptable [to the senses]. 3. To hold, to contain. 4. To become. 5. To be used for./n. Root given as 'gro < ' + TB *ga + *ro, *ro < TB *ra 'to come' (Delancey ￼1908: 233)/n.song < s + *ong, *ong < TB *wang (Delancey 1980: 233)./n. The past tense song is more typical of eastern dialects whereas phyin more of central dialects. Denwood's imperative is for Lhasa dialect. For more etymological thoughts on motion verbs compare 'ong.

/p.འགྲོགས་ འགྲོག་ /ps.འགྲོགས་ /f.འགྲོགས་ འགྲོག་/imp.-འགྲོགས་Iནནོལུནཏརཡ: /vl. /int. /tr. /synt. [Abs. Ass.] /m. To associate with; to keep company, to be in the company of; to accompnay To be accompanied by; to associate with; to stay together To act with mutual connection, to co-habitate, to co-operate To accompany, to associate with./n. Perhaps to be compared with rogs 'help'
འགྲོང་ give as the present of དགྲོང་

/p.འགྲོང་འགྲོངས་ /ps.འགྲོང་ གྲོང་ གྲོངས་ /f.འགྲོང་ འགྲོངས་/imp.- གྲོངས་Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int./res.དགྲོང་Denominative of:རོ་ 'corpse'(Hahn 1999: 124)/m. To die (honorific) To die./n. Root given as 'g- ro - ng (Hahn 1999: 124)
འགྲོད་ gives as a present of བགྲོད་

/p.འགྲོལ་ དགྲོལ་ /ps.བཀྲོལ་ བཀྲོལད་ /f.དགྲོལ་ /imp.ཁྲོལ་ཁྲོལད་ གྲོལད་ /vl. /tr. /cs.གྲོལ་ /res.སྒྲོལ་[Duff]/ch.ex.མདུད་པ་སོགས་ མདུད་བཅིངས་སོགས་ (འགྲོལ་), བཅིངས་པ་སོགས་(དགྲོལ་), མདུད་པ་ཁྲིམས་ /m. To unravel, to make loose, to set free, to unfasten To loosen; to set free from bondage 1. (for a knot, tied rope &c.) To unravel, unwind. 2. (for a higher ranking [person]) To allow, approve 1. To untie, to unravel, to liberate, to release, to unfasten. 2. To comment on, to elucidate.
[2]འགྲོལ་ or {'grold} give as the present of གྲོལ་

/p.རྒ་ རྒད་ /ps.རྒས་ /f.རྒ་/imp.རྒས་ -/inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. To be old, aged. 2. To go down, to set (of the sun) (Ja) To become old; to become physically weak, to become lean and thin 1. (for men or cattle) To age. 2. To become old, for time to pass To age, to grow old./n. Root given as rga < *gra /n. related to the nouns rgad po, rgad mo, rgan po, rgan mo, rgas po, rgas mo 'old man, old woman' and the verb bgres.

/p.རྒོལ་ rgal /ps.བརྒལད་བརྒལ་ /f.བརྒལ་/imp.རྒོལད་ རྒོལ་ /vl. /int. Transitive /synt. [e.a]./res.{sgrol}/ch.ex.ཆུ་སོགས་དང་གཞན་དང་ phar la/m. To ford (a river), to travel through, to pass over, to surmount a pass To cross the river, to cross a limit, to take a bath To cross (a river, valley, pass). 2. To pass, exceed a measure. 3. To go into water To cross, to traverse, to go beyond, to exceed./n. Root given as rgal < *gral./n. gives rgal ba and rgal pa, the latter perhaps indicates the variant rgald pa.

/p.རྒུད་ /ps.རྒུད་ /f.རྒུད་/imp.རྒུད་ -./inv./int. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.རླུང་རྟ་སོགས་/m. To decline, to sink, grow fail To decay; to decline; to become weak or smaller To break down (of power, ability &c. ) To decline, to deteriorate.
རྒོད་ give as a separate verb from and, give as an an alternate present of དགོད་

/p.རྒོལ་ /ps.བརྒལད་ བརྒལ་རྒོལ. rgol. /f.བརྒལ་ བརྒོལ་/imp.རྒོལད་ རྒོལ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /m. To dispute, combat, fight, make controversy To find out by debating, to debate 1. To fight. 2. To negate To oppose, to attack, to assault, to resist./n. Whether intends these forms here or a rgal cannot be known.

[1]/p.རྒྱ་ རྒྱས་ /ps.རྒྱས་ /f.རྒྱ་རྒྱས་/imp.-རྒྱས་Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:. /vl. /int/synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.སངས་(-), sangs rgya dmigs rgya (rgyas) /m. To increase in bulk or quantity, to augment, to spread To increase, enlarge, flourish To increase, to multiply To increase, to swell, to grow larger, to develop.
[2]/p.རྒྱ་/m. To be useful and of service, to exert oneself.

[1]/p.རྒྱོབ་ རྒྱབ་ རྒྱག་( Central Dialect) རྒྱེག་ /ps.བརྒྱབ་བརྒྱབས་ rgyag /f.བརྒྱབ་ བརྒྱག་ རྒྱག ￼. /imp.རྒྱོབ་ རྒྱབས་ རྒྱག /vl., /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ཟོར་དང་མཚོན་སོགས་ rdo sogs/m. To throw, to fling; to hit, to beat, to strike The meaning of this verb differs according to context, e.g. to build; to shoot; to reply; to mark, etc. 1. i. To strike, to hit. ii. A house, wall etc. to make new. iii. To propel to cast 2. In the colloquial language there are many definitions, used like འཇུག་ To project, propel away, send off; to enter, place inside; to do; to make /n. Root given as rgyab < *གརྱབ་ /n. lists two verbs རྒྱག་ and རྒྱབ་ རྒྱབས་ བརྒྱབ་ རྒྱབས་/རྒྱོབ་ with nearly identical meanings. conjectures that the termination -b is original. This verb is frequently added to nouns to form new verbs, it generally indicates a voluntary verb, whereas 'thebs is used in the same way to indicate lack of volition or to show that the action was well done.
[2]/p.རྒྱག་ /ps.བརྒྱབ་ /f.རྒྱག་ /imp.-./inv./int. /m. To rise, to emit.

[1]/p.རྒྱགས་ རྒྱག་ /ps.བརྒྱགས་ /f.བརྒྱག་/imp.རྒྱགས་ རྒྱོགས་ - /vl. /inv.Intransitive : /int. /ch.ex.ནོར་དང་ང་རྒྱལ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་ /m. To use provisions on a journey To give a bribe of wealth To be full, to be satisfied, to be satiated./n. evidently conflates this verb with the following. fits here morphologically but semantically is better at brgyags. The relationship between these three verbs (རྒྱགས་1, རྒྱགས་2, བརྒྱགས་) is hardly clear.
[2]/p.རྒྱགས་ /ps.རྒྱགས་ /f.རྒྱགས་ /imp.རྒྱགས་ - /inv./int. /m. To be self satisfied, to be haughty, priggish To be self satisfied.

/p.རྒྱང་ /ps.བརྒྱངས་ /f.བརྒྱང་/imp.རྒྱངས་/m. To stretch, extend, stretch forth (one's hands to a person), put out (the tongue); spread; distend (the wings, a curtain) To cause to be delayed; to extend./n. Root given as rgyang < *gryang./n. Compare: rgyong and rkyong.

/p.རྒྱན་ /ps.བརྒྱནད་ བརྒྱན་ /f.བརྒྱན་/imp.རྒྱནད་ རྒྱན་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a].Denominative of:རྒྱན་ «ornament» /ch.ex.རྒྱན་དང་དར་སོགས་ཀྱིས་/m. To ornament; to beautify or to decorate, to wear or to put on To adorn, ornament To adorn, ornament, to decorate.
རྒྱབ་ give as the present of རྒྱག་

[1]/p.རྒྱལ་ /ps.རྒྱལད་ རྒྱལ་ /f.རྒྱལ་/imp.རྒྱལ་ -./inv./int. /synt. [Abs. Abl/Ela.] /ch.ex.གཞན་དང་ཤོ་སོགས་ལས་ /m. To be victorious; to win; to conquer; to subdue, to overpower To win, conquer, subdue 1. To remain having defeated an opposing side or enemy. 2. To be superior than another To be victorious, to conquer.
[2]རྒྱལ་ gives as the present of བརྒྱལ་
རྒྱས་  give as the present of རྒྱ་

/p.རྒྱུ་ /ps.རྒྱུ་ /f.རྒྱུ་/imp.རྒྱུ་ -./inv./int. /m. To go, walk, move, wander, range (this verb is generally used instead of 'gro in Sikkim) To go; to move To go To move, to roam, to go./n. Compare: 'gyu
རྒྱུ་ (). give as the present of རྒྱུད་
[1]/p.རྒྱུག་ /ps.རྒྱུག་ རྒྱུགས་ /f.རྒྱུག་/imp.རྒྱུག་ རྒྱུགས་ /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To run; to race 1. To run. 2. To flow. 3. To sell, engage in commerce.

[2]/p.རྒྱུག་ /ps.བརྒྱུགས་ /f.བརྒྱུག་/imp.རྒྱུགས་ རྒྱུག་ - /vl. /inv./int. /tr. /synt. [Erg.]. [e.a] /ch.ex.རྟ་སོགས་ sngon rjes sogs su, rta zong dang sogs(rgyugs) , rta dangzongsogs(rgyugs), zongsogs(-) /m. To run To run a race; to make one run To race.
/p.རྒྱུགས་ /ps.རྒྱུགས་ /f.རྒྱུགས་ /imp.རྒྱུགས་ /m. To serve; to serve drink.
/p.རྒྱུང་ /ps.རྒྱུངས་ /f.རྒྱུང་/imp.རྒྱུངས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To wash the stomach (as with cleansing medicine).

/p.རྒྱུད་ རྒྱུ་(). /ps.བརྒྱུས་ /f.བརྒྱུ་/imp.རྒྱུས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.ཕྲེང་བ་སོགས་ skud pa mig la/m. To tie, fasten, connect together (rgyud) To make a string of, to stick together (brgyus) To string; to put in line To put a rope or thread through a hole To thread, to string.
[2]རྒྱུད་ gives as present of བརྒྱུད་
རྒྱེག་ gives as the present of རྒྱག་

/p.རྒྱོ་ (dialect) /ps.བརྒྱོས་ /f.བརྒྱོ་/imp.རྒྱོས་ /vl. /m. To have sexual intercourse; (acc. to Cs.) To deflower, ravish To deflower; to have sexual intercourse To have sexual intercourse (archaic) To have sexual intercourse.

/p.རྒྱོང་ བརྒྱང་ /ps.བརྒྱངས་ /f.བརྒྱང་ /imp.རྒྱོངས་ /vl. /int. /tr. /ch.ex.པགས་པ་སོགས་ gru sogs/m. To extend, stretch forth, distend (rgyong) To extend, stretch out, set out, arrange (brgyang) To fill up, to stretch.1. To stretch, to extend, to distend. 2. To fill up./n. Root given as *rgyang < *gryang (Coblin 1986).
རྒྱོབ་ gives as the present of རྒྱག་
/p.རྒྱོར་ /m. To kill.
/p.སྒག་ /ps.བསྒགས་ /f.བསྒག་/imp.ཁོག་སྒོགས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.མནའ་སོགས་/m. To ravish, to copulate; to embrace in sexual union To bind, to tie, to fasten.
/p.སྒང་ /ps.བསྒང་ བསྒོངས་ /f.བསྒང་/imp.སྒོངས་ སྒངས་ /vl./cs.gang[]/ch.ex.ཟས་སོགས་/m. To grow, become full (Cs.) To cause to fill./n. Compare: kheng, skong, 'geng.

/p.སྒབ་ སྒོབ་ /ps.བསྒབས་ བསྒབ་ /f.བསྒབ་/imp.སྒོབས་ སྒོབ་ /vl. /tr./cs.'gebs, (Coblin 1986)/ch.ex.འདྲི་དངསྲི་སོགས་/m. To cover To cause to cover or to spread over; to cause to wear or patch.1. To cover, to conceal. 2. To protect./n. Compare: the noun khebs 'a cover'.
/p.སྒར་ /ps.བསྒརད་ བསྒར་ /f.བསྒར་/imp.སྒོརད་ སྒོར་ /vl. /tr. /m. To dip fry; to solidify in oil 1. To condense, solidify. 2. To attach, to fit, to insert.
/p.སྒལ་ /cs.'gel[Coblin 1986]/m. To carry a load (on one's back), to cause a load to be carried on the back of a beast of burden./n. Compare: the noun khal 'a load, burden'.

/p.སྒུག་ /ps.བསྒུགས་ /f.བསྒུག་ TD གིནེས་ བསྒྲུབ, an obvious manuscript error/imp.སྒུགས་  སྐུགས་ /vl., /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.རྗེས་ལ་ grogs po sogs, lam du /m. To wait To wait for./n. This word may be a causative formed on a stem *gug. Perhaps it is cognate to 'gugs pa 'to summon' and 'gugs pab po 'one who is summoned, a waiter' (Coblin 1986).

/p.སྒུར་ /ps.བསྒུརད་ བསྒུར་ སྒུར. /f.སྒུར་ བསྒུར་/imp.སྒུརད་ སྒུར་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.རྐེད་པ་སོགས་/m. To become afraid To cause to bow down, to bend down Of the body, to bend forward To bend, to bend down.

/p.སྒུལ་ /ps.བསྒུལད་ བསྒུལ་ /f.བསྒུལ་/imp.སྒུལད་ སྒུལ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'gul,, /ch.ex.ལགཔ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་ g-yo ba'i/m. To move, agitate, put in motion To shake; to cause to move 1. To make something move, or shake. 2. To cause a transformation To move, to shake, to agitate.
/p.སྒེག་ (Goldstein 2001)/m. To brag, boast (Cs.) To be charming, graceful (Goldstein 2001)

/p.སྒོ་ /ps.བསྒོས་ /f.བསྒོ་￼/imp.སྒོས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'go (Duff, def. 2 )/ch.ex.དྲི་བཟང་སོགས་སྐྱིས་ dka' dang dus ra dri ma sogs (?)/m. (obsolete) To say; to speak, (mostly) to bid, to order To order; to cause to be predisposed; to be habituated 1. To make one thing to stick to or contaminate another thing. 2. To teach to another 1. To command, to order, to exhort, to instruct. 2. To be contaminated, to be polluted./n. lists the fut seperatley with definition 'to rub with; to apply on'. only gives the definition 'to soil, stain, defile, infect with disease'.

/p.སྒོག་ /ps.བསྒགས་ /f.བསྒག་/imp.སྒོགས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.མནའ་་/m. To make one swear (Cs.) To make one swear; to cause to take an oath 1. To bind tightly. 2. To restrict, prohibit. 3. To coerce, force, compel To take an oath, to swear an oath.

[1]/p.སྒོང་ /ps.བསྒངས་ བསྒོངས་ /f.བསྒང་ བསྒོང་ /imp.སྒོངས་ སྒོང་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.ཟན་སོགས་ zas sogs dang gcig tu/m. To make in tea balls to eat [sic], to make round balls of dough (Cs.). To make a globular mass: to heap; to make paste for food To make into a ball (barley flower &c.).To make into a ball.
[2]/p.སྒོང་ /ps.སྒོང་བསྒོངས་ /f.སྒོང་བསྒོང་ /imp.སྒོངས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To load firewood &c. on to a fire (dialect) To heap fuel onto a fire.
/p.སྒོང་སྒོངས་ /m. To hide; to conceal (a thing) (Sch.).
སྒོབ་ gives as the present of སྒབ་

/p.སྒོམ་ /ps.བསྒོམས་ /f.བསྒོམ་/imp.སྒོམས་ སྒོམ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.goms[Duff]/ch.ex.ཏིང་ངེ་འཛིན་ ting nge 'dzind sogs, ting 'dzin/m. 1. (originally) to fancy, imagine. 2. (now, with accusative and dative) To meditate, contemplate systematically. 3. (with accusative and terminative, or with double accusative) To have; to entertain; to reproduce (in one's mind) To meditate, to practice meditation; to cultivate in meditation To bring to memory again and again in the mind To meditate.

/p.སྒོར་ /ps.བསྒརད་ བསྒར་ /f.བསྒར་/imp.སྒོརད་ སྒོར་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.བུ་རམ་སོགས་ bu ram/m. 1. To boil down; to condense by boiling. 2. To turn on a lathe (Ja) 1. To make syrup by boiling down tree sap. 2. (dialect) To invert a vessel.
/p.སྒྱང་ སྒྱོང་ /ps.བསྒྱངས་ /f.བསྒྱང་  བསྒྱོང་/imp.སྒྱངས་ སྒྱོངས་ /vl. /tr./cs.འགྱང་[]/ch.ex.དུས་སོགས་ རིང་དུ་ /m. To cause a delay./n. Compare: འགྱངས་

/p.སྒྱིང་ བསྒྱིངས་ /ps.བསྒྱིངས་ /f.བསྒྱིང་བསྒྱིངས་ /imp.སྒྱིངས་ - /vl. /tr. /int./cs.'gying, /ch.ex.ཉམས་ཀྱིས་རྣམ་པར་ sengge rnam par /m. To yawn, to gape To display emotion through physical posture To yawn and to stretch out the limbs when tired.2. To straighten. 3. To leap, jump, to be erect. 1. To sigh, to stretch the limbs. 2. To straighten. 3. To leap, to jump, to act haughtily.

/p.སྒྱུར་ /ps.བསྒྱུརད་ བསྒྱུར་ /f.བསྒྱུར་/imp.སྒྱུརད་ སྒྱུར་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'gyur, /ch.ex.ཆོས་སོགས་ chos sogs dang chos kyis, dbang dang skad mdog bon chos /m. 1. To transform, alter, change, to correct; translate; revise. 2. To cast aside; dissuade, divert; to turn; to cause to turn. 3. To govern, steer, control (sgyur) To multiply, increase (bsgyur) To translate; to change; to transform; to multiply 1. To change, transform (method, essence, characteristic, direction, &c.). 2. To translate. 3. To take control, power. 4. To make various kinds of sound appear (from an instrument &c.). 5. To multiply. 6. To show various styles of body (as in dance &c.). 7. To drive away, expel, repel, reverse 1. To change, to transform, to alter. 2. To translate, to interpret. 3. (math) To multiply, times, fold.

/p.སྒྱེལ་ /ps.བསྒྱེལད་ བསྒྱེལ་ /f.བསྒྱེལ་/imp.སྒྱེལད་ སྒྱེལ་ /vl. /int. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'gyel, /ch.ex.རྩིག་པ་སོགས་ shing dang gyang sogs, kan rkyal dang par la.gan rkyal dang phar la/m. To throw down, to overturn, to lay or put down (a bottle, a book); to thwart (the charm of an enemy); to kill (Ja) To cause to fall down; to cause to break down, to overturn To cause to a person or upright thing to lie horizontally To cause to fall down, to bring down to overthrow, to thwart, to be thrown down./n. Compare: dgyel
/p.སྒྱོང་ /ps.བསྒྱོངས་ /f.བསྒྱོང་/m. 1. To fill, to stuff (a sausage). 2. (colloquial in West) to put into (the pocket)./n. Perhaps originally = sgong 'to hide'.
[2]སྒྱོང་ND gives as the present of སྒྱང་
སྒྲང་ give as the present of སྒྲོང་
སྒྲད་ gives as the present of བསྒྲད་
/p.སྒྲལ་ /m. 1. To cut into small pieces, viz. the picture of an enemy one wishes to destroy (Ja). 2. To pass over or travel upon a river or sea.

/p.སྒྲིག་ /ps.བསྒྲིགས་ /f.བསྒྲིག་/imp.སྒྲིགས་སྒྲིག་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'grig/ch.ex.གྲལ་དུ་ go rim sogs, cho ga dang bral la /m. To arrange in order or row, to lay or put in order, to arrange, adjust; to put or fit together; to join (the separate parts), to compile (books), to stitch close [sic](books etc.) To put in order; to arrange or to rectify 1. To arrange in a certain plain, order. 2. To collect in one place. 3. To mutually agree, be in one house 1. To arrange, to put in order, to align. 2. To compile, to collect, to edit, to assemble, to join together.

/p.སྒྲིན་ (archaic) /ps.བསྒྲིནད་ བསྒྲིན་ /f.བསྒྲིན་/imp.སྒྲིནད་ སྒྲིན་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.ཕན་ཚུན་/m. To have a competition; to cause to compete or to compare (archaic) To contest for victory.To rival, compete with, to compare.

/p.སྒྲིབ་ /ps.བསྒྲིབས་ /f.བསྒྲིབ་/imp.སྒྲིབས་སྒྲིབ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'grib, /ch.ex.འོད་སོགས་ zla nyi sogs, yol bas /m. To obscure; to cover, to darken, defile To cover, to hide by covering, to hide To cover, hide, create an obstacle for seeing something To obscure, to cover, to conceal.

/p.སྒྲིམ་ /ps.བསྒྲིམས་ ￼ /f.བསྒྲིམ་ /imp.སྒྲིམས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.grim, /ch.ex.བློ་དང་སྐུད་པ་སོགས་ rig pa dang skud pa sogs, rig las skud pa. rig pa las dang skud pa/m. 1. To hold fast; to force or twist together; to endeavor; (Cs.) to squeeze in, crow in, (Sch.) to be confused To concentrate; to exercise the mental power on; to pay attention; to spin or twist the threads together, to entwine 1. To tightly spin (rope, thread &c.). 2. To be intelligent, careful 1. To concentrate, to focus. 2. To twist together.

/p.སྒྲིལད་ སྒྲིལ་ /ps.བསྒྲིལད་ བསྒྲིལ་ /f.བསྒྲིལ་/imp.སྒྲིལད་ སྒྲིལ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'gril, (Rona-Tas 1978: 359). 'khril []/ch.ex.ཐིག་སྐུད་སོགས་ mar la dang gcig tu /m. To make a roll of, to roll, wrap up; to wind into a spool To fold, to wrap up; to cause to fold or roll up; to combine 1. To make something roll. 2. To roll up, make into a ball. 3. To twist, braid, spin (rope and thread) 1. To twist, to wind. 2. To combine, to muster. 3. To stuff. 4. To barter, to convert currency, to exchange currency, exchange merchandise. 5. (math) To convert lower digits into higher numeric places./n.(Rona-Tas 1978: 359) calls 'dril 'to be turned, rolled round, twisted into a thing.' the 'passive' of this verb, in addition he suggests a connection to the adjective hril po 'round, globular, close, dense' and the noun ril ba 'scroll'.

/p.སྒྲུག་ /ps.བསྒྲུགས་ /f.བསྒྲུག་ /imp.སྒྲུགས་ སྒྲུག་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]/ch.ex.རྡོ་བ་སོགས་ shing sogs/m. To collect, gather, pluck, pick To collect; to pick up 1. To gather, collect. 2. (in some dialects) To take care of, preserve To pick up, to gather, to collect.
/p.སྒྲུང་ /ps.བསྒྲུངས་ /f.བསྒྲུང་/imp.སྒྲུངས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To mix, to invert, to feign (Cs.) To cause to purify To absorb, having been wet in water To dissolve.

/p.སྒྲུན་ (archaic). /ps.བསྒྲུནད་ བསྒྲུན་ /f.བསྒྲུན་/imp.སྒྲུནད་ སྒྲུན་ /vl. /tr. /cs.'gran/ch.ex.ཡོན་ཏན་སོགས་ཕན་ཚུན་ 'bran pa'i /m. 1. To resound; to reply in the same tone; to rival. 2. To compare; emulate, vie, contend with (Cs.) To have competition; to compete; to compare To compete, rival To rival, to compare.

/p.སྒྲུབ་ /ps.བསྒྲུབས་ /f.བསྒྲུབ་ /imp.སྒྲུབས་ སྒྲུབ་ /vl. /tr., /synt. [e.a]./cs.'grub, /ch.ex.ཆོ་སྒྲུབ་སོགས་ cho ga dang tshe sgrub sogs, bya ba chos sogs /m. To complete, finish, carry out, accomplish To carry out; to accomplish; to perform 1. To do an action. 2. To judge the truth, having presented arguments and scriptural citations. 3. To take on the means of religion 1. To attain, to do, to perform, to carry out, to execute. 2. To procure, to gain to acquire through effort. 3. (logic) To prove, to affirm, to establish, to establish a proof. 4. (math) To calculate, to find the value of, to make. 5. To attain, to practice religion, to perfect.

/p.སྒྲེ་ /ps.བསྒྲེས་ བསྒྲེ་ /f.བསྒྲེ་/imp.སྒྲེས་ /vl. /tr. /cs.'gre/ch.ex.རིགས་པས་གོང་འོག་སོགས་ rigs /m. To repeat; to put or place in order; put together; collate To yoke; to apply the same method 1. To compare a known situation in order to know a similar situation. 2. To churn something inside a liquid (such as water) To collate, to juxtapose, to assimilate.
/p.སྒྲེག་ /ps.སྒྲེགས་/m. To belch.

/p.སྒྲེང་ /ps.བསྒྲེངས་ /f.བསྒྲེང་/imp.སྒྲེངས་ སྒྲེང་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.'greng,, [Coblin 1986], /ch.ex.རྒྱལ་མཚན་ rgyal mtshan sogs, rgyal mtshan dar sogs/m. To lift, hoist, rise up To make stand up, to make erect To erect, to raise up, to hoist.

/p.སྒྲོ་ /ps.བསྒྲོས་ /f.བསྒྲོ་/imp.སྒྲོ་ བསྒྲོས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To debate, discuss, chatter freely 1. 'go bar bya pa'i [to make into a head], e.g. 'go nad mi la ma bsgo. 2. To speak to others (e.g. a teacher to students).

[1]/p.སྒྲོག་ /ps.བསྒྲགས་ /f.བསྒྲག་ /imp.སྒྲོགས་ སྒྲག་ སྒྲགས. /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs.grags, /ch.ex.དམ་ཚིག་དང་དྲིལ་བུ་ dam tshig dang bka' shog sogs, skad sgra /m. To call, ￼shout forth, publish, proclaim, declare To read; to announce; to declare; to proclaim, promulgate 1. To make a large noise. 2. To make known to all by speaking from the mouth or presenting in writing To call out, to shout out, to roar, to proclaim, to read aloud.

[2]/p.སྒྲོག་ /ps.བསྒྲོགས་ /f.བསྒྲོག་/imp.སྒྲོགས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To mend; to re-stitch To bind with a rope &c. the feet and hands of men and cattle 1. To sew, to stitch. 2. To tie, to fasten, to attach.

Other dictionaries, list the word only as an archaic noun 'sin, fault.'

To parch (barley, wheat, or rice); to bruise, to roast; to fry (e.g. meat in a pan) (rngod). (barley) To be cropped (Situ 77) (brngod) To roast barley, fry meat, &c. The spoken Tibetan non-causative nghoo has no written Tibetan correspondent, and may be a secondary derivative, formed by analogy to such pairs as par 'to cause to be increased', phar 'to be increased'.
