To not respect, not comply, not agree to. 4. To make fewer 1. To break, split, fragment. 2. To oppress, to suppress. 3. To reduce, deduct, lower. 4. To contradict, to break a pledge, to disobey.

To cut, to cut asunder, to cut down, to fell; (variety of metaphorical uses) stop, hinder, judge, avoid, lock, to wake from sleep To hew or cut; to decide a case 1. To cut a long thing into a short one. 2. To settle, determine. 3. To follow pursue ￼something gone earlier. 4. To examine a circumstance and come to have knowledge. 5. To sever, stop, cut off. 6. To quite (a bad habit &c.). 7. To block, obstruct. 8. To kill. 9. To break off a previous mutual connection. 10. To annihilate, get rid of. 11. To arrive at a goal. 12. To understand a profound meaning having analyzed and argued. 13. To block of the end (of a hole &c.) by stuffing in something round 1. To cut, to shear, to shave off. 2. To kill. 3. To intervene, to interrupt. 3. To give up, to abandon, to stop, to break off. 5. To close, to block off, to impede. 6. To establish, to determine. 7. To implement, to execute, to exact. 8. To explore, to investigate, to pursue. 9. To differentiate, to discriminate, to scrutinize, to analyze, to discern. 10. To traverse, to arrive after a journey.

To crush, to squeeze.

To abate, beat down from the price To be broken 1. To break apart, be broken. 2. To not do what was to be done at a certain time [i.e. to be interrupted]. 3. To decrease, become less To break, to fragment, to be broken. 2. To be interrupted.

To keep in mind, to retain.

To cease, end, stop, die To be broken off, be cut off; to discontinue; to be tired 1. For a long thing to break into pieces. 2. To separate into many sections. 3. To be omitted, discarded. 4. To degenerate, decay, cease to exit To be interrupted, to be broken, to be cut off. 2. To be incomplete, to be missing./n. Compare: (Takeuchi 1995: 223).

To arise, to start up, become visible, shine To rise, to start 1. (for the light of sun, moon, or stars) To spread, come out from the snyom thig of the east. 2. For the flower of a fruit tree to bloom. 3. (of a new era) To arrive. 4. To know or remember. 5. To reflect in a mirror &c. 1. To arise, to emerge, to occur, to dawn, to bloom. 2. To become. 3. To recollect. 4. To be calculated, to be given, to be left (made in an arithmetic calculation).

To fornicate, to commit adultery To be out of order, to be disorderly or to be in a state of confusion 1. To deteriorate in good activity of body and speech. 2. To deteriorate in understanding. 3. To be slanted (of a wall face) To lose control, to be or become deranged. 2. (dialect) To tilt, to be unstable. 3. To be promiscuous, to fornicate.

To distill (Situ 75) (bcu) To draw out water, to fetch water To pick up sand, water &c. with a ladle &c. and pour it into a vessel 1. To fetch with a vessel. 2. To loose appetite. 3. (archaic) To plunder./n. related to the noun bcud 'humor, elixir' (Stein 1942: 205). Related to the nouns ￼chab 'water' and bca 'drink' by ablaut (Simon 1971: 474).

To loose appetite. 2. To become crooked or in the shape of a twisted conch To be or get twisted, to sprain, to be or get sprained.

To have another attend to an affair having given something to another To entrust, to charge with, to leave in someone's charge, to deposit.

K. 1. 24) 1. 1o apprehend, to grasp (with the understanding); to impress (generally with yid la 'on the mind'). 2. relative to persons it may be synonymous with chags pa 'to love' (gcags) To keep in mind, to memorize To bear in mind, hold in mind.

To cool down, become cold./n. gives bzhams, and gzhams as archaic equivalents of 'jam bo 'soft, tender'. gives no indication of which stem his forms are assigned to.

To account for whether a thing is heavy or light, long or short, many or few etc, with instruments. 2. To analyze and understand. 3. To pay (e.g. taxes, a loan) 1. To measure, weigh. 2. To appraise, examine. 3. To repay, to return.

To go, arrive To enter, to join, to set out, to embark on.

[2]/p.འཇུག་ /ps.བཅུག་ འཇུགས་ /f.གཞུག་ /imp.ཆུགས་ ￼. ཆུག་ /vl., /tr. /synt. [e.a] /cs. zhugs /ch.ex.ནངདུ་དངབཏན་པལ་་ tshogs dangnangdu nangdu /m. 1. To put into, insert, infuse. inject. 2. To appoint, constitute, manifest, place out, settle. 3. To command, induce. 4. To permit, allow suffer (in sense 3 and 4 with the terminative case of root of verb [sic]) 1. To put in, insert, to admit. 2. To cause to enter to make or to allow to do 1. To make go inside from outside (e.g. sheep). 2. To put a thing in its container. 3. To be put in order, series (e.g. a student into a particular class). 4. An auxiliary verb indicating the double causative. 5 (when prefixed by kha) To speak 1. To insert, to place in, to put in, to infuse, to inject. 2. To introduce, to induce, to admit into, to induct, cause to enter. 3. To engage in, to participate, to undertake. 4. To encourage, to let, to permit, to allow, to cause to./n. Root given as jug (= ?xug) < *dzyug < dzug cf. 'dzugs 'jug < (='-d-zhug < *'zhug) [].
/p.འཇུད་ (archaic). /tr. (Skorupski 2001), (Goldstein 2001)/m. [To go into, enter]. (archaic) To enter, put inside (archaic) To cause to enter, to insert, to induce./n. Compare: chud.

To subdue, make tame. To make confess. To make soft, soften. To punish (by words or blows). To convert To subdue, control, subjugate, restrain To make (someone or something) obey a command, using force 1. To subdue, to take, to discipline, to shape. 2. (archaic) to keep in mind.

Properly to cause to shudder, but frequently as neutral verb to contract To make smaller, contract To become shorter 1. To contract, to shrink. 2. (archaic) To reduce pride./n. gives 'jum as the past in his main entry, but transliterates it as the impossible bjum, he lists bcum separately as the past of this verb, and perhaps that is what was meant to appear in the main entry as well.
འཇུམས་ gives as the present of ཞུམ་

To make judgments, after carefully examining the good and bad qualities of something To coarsely investigate, analyze, judge.

(common in West) To look for, to search for. 3. To view mentally, to consider, look into, examine, investigate To look, to see 1. To see with the eyes. 2. To examine, investigate. 3. To visit, see, call on. 4. To desire, crave, love. 5. To think, consider, ponder 1. To see, know with the eyes. 2. To research, examine, analyze. 3. To desire, crave, love.

/p.ལྟན་ /m. (archaic) To come, arrive, receive, get.

To fall down. 2. To become smaller, fewer To fall down./n. Root given as ltung < t + ལྷུང་ (Hahn 1999: 125)./n. Perhaps to be connected to the noun klung 'valley'. Compare: also the syllable slungs occurring in the entries from (ngag dbang tshul khrim 1997)slungs stod smad 'place name' and slungs tshangs 'the lower juncture of a road' [].

To fold, gather up, to lay together, put together To fold up (clothes &c.) To bend a flat thing and stack one of its two faces upon the other To bend something back and forth and stack one of its two faces upon ￼the other.

To cause to be together 1. To request to be a student. 2. To do, behave, use. 3. To be firm in mind, find key mental points To stay near, serve, accompany.

To put into another's mouth, to feed. 2. To offer, make a donation To give, give and take To give, offer something to another (e.g. food) To offer, give.

To overstep a nation's law. 3. To disappear once dead To become clean./n. suggests this as evidence of the sound change zl a *lz a *ld a 'd, connecting it to the verb ldag 'lick' and zlag (zlog (?)) however he seems to rely to heavily on for his definition, compare ldag.

/p.འདའ་  /ps.འདས་ /f.འདའ་ /imp.འདའ་ - /inv./int. /synt. [Abs. Abl/Ela.] /ch.ex.དམ་ཚིག་སོགས་ལས་་/m. To pass away, to go beyond, to surmount, get the better of 1. For time to elapse. 2. For a number to increase, to pass beyond the boundary of a group. 3. To die. 4. For a period of time to be finished. 5. To be superior in a characteristic 1. To pass beyond a boundary. 2. For life to finish, to die./n. gives this as evidence of the sound change zla a lza a lda a 'da.

/p.འདར་ /ps.འདརད་ འདར་ /f.འདར་ /imp.འདར་ ￼. -./inv./int. /m. To shiver, to tremble (usually with cold or fear), to shudder 1. For something to very quickly move back and forth. 2. To reverse, change To quiver, shake.

[1]/p.འདལ་ འདལད་ /ps.དལད་ འདལ་ /f.འདལ་ /imp.འདོལད་ འདོལ་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /res. bdal /m. To sink down To spread over, to be absorbed, to smudge To become larger through soaking with water To spread./n. also connects the verb to gdal.
[2]/p.འདལད་ /ps.དལ་ /f.འདལ་ /imp.དལད་ /m. To be free from other works, to be slow.

To spread on the ground (a mat &c.), lay out, sprinkle, strew (grass, hay) To spread mats &c., to lay down foundations, to plan To spread something on the surface of the ground To organize, lay out on the ground.

/p.འདུ་ /ps.འདུས་ /f.འདུ་ /imp.འདུས་ -./inv. /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o]./res. sdud, (Laufer 1915: 62) 'thu /ch.ex.གནས་དང་ཚང་སོགས་ལ་་ mgron bzhi sogs /m. 1. To collect, accumulate. 2. To come together, to assemble (of men and animals). 3. To get married, to unite, to join together. 4. (in philosophical language) To unite. 5. To consist of, in 1. For many things to assemble. 2. To classify. 3. To mix together To assemble./n.(Stein 1942: 205) suggests this verb is connected to dud 'tie' sdud 'join, unite, marry' mdun ma 'spouse', 'dun ma 'council, association, society, fiance' mdud pa 'knot' and dun ma 'assembly' found in Dunhuang texts along with the variants 'dun tsha, 'dun sa, mdu tsa, bdun tsa. To this adds sdud 'fold of a garment.'
[1]/p.འདུག་  /ps.འདུག་ /f.འདུག་ /imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. To sit, remain. 2. To be 1. To sit. 2. To remain, exist.

[2]/aux.'dug /fn.If annexed to a simple root, the present tense is usually indicated, used with kyi, gin, gi a periphrastic present tense. With nas, bas, te and shing an imperfect tense with the sense, 'it seems' Auxiliary verb of the present stem 1. To sit, to stay. 2. To exist ￼obviously.
འདུང་ gives as the present of བདུང་

To convert To subdue, to subjugate, to bring under control, to tame, make useful ￼1. To defeat. 2. To tame (a horse &c.). 3. To change, transform. 4. To powder, reduce to powder To make something bad good./n. Compare: gdul.

To weigh To raise up, to lift up, to offer, to weight, measure To [put] something up high 1. To lift up, raise up. 2. To lift upon a scale.

To bear away, bear along, bear off, to hurry off. 3. To call in, collect, recover To drive, to chase 1. To drive away, expel. 2. To chase after in order to apprehend 1. To drive away, to chase after. 2. To incite, provoke, make act. 3. To count, look into, investigate.

To urge (cattle &c) to return. 2. To chase after (game animals &c.) in order to catch. 3. To collect a debt. 4. To probe, to pursue thorough investigation. 5. To drive away.

To ask, offer, pray.

To speak about nothing (a fault, mistake &c.). 4. To establish benefit To tie, bind./n.(Haarh 1969: 313) refers the noun bdag 'owner, self' to the past stem of this verb, he also connects this verb with the archaic terms dog, rdog, and bdog.

/p.འདོང་ འདོངས་ /ps.དོང་ འདོང་ དེངས /f.འདོང་ དོང་ /imp.དོང་ འདོང་ དེངས dongs /vl. /int. /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.ཕྱིར་ལ་་/m. (archaic) To go, to proceed To go (archaic) To go, travel To go, go out, depart./n. Compare: 'deng.

To cause to go out, come forth, expel, throw out, eject To take, bring out, to expel, turn out 1. To read a book. 2. To take out, draw out. 3. To speak 1. To take out, open. 2. To speak, read. 3. To enthrone, install in power./n. Attested in the phrase 'don 'dond(Richardson 1985: 45 line 15). (Zeisler 2004: 458) interprets 'dond as the present, whereas (Li & Coblin 1987:414) give 'don 'dond as the 'continuative' of 'don.

To assemble, to come together. 3. To demonstrate, explain. 4. To select, to choose To give advice, to advise To teach with helpful words To show, to teach.

To cast forth, to throw out, to eject, to reject, to fling away, to sweep off, sweep away, to give up To throw, to give up, to cast aside 1. To separate, break a connection. 2. To discard, throw away. 3. To not carry mentally To give up, send away, discard, throw away.

To scratch, scrape, tear with the claws To scratch, to rub with the finger nails, to rub ('drad) To scrape with finger nails, to scratch, to rub, to draw ('brad) To dig at the hard top surface (e.g. of the ground) To pick, pluck, tear ('drad) To comb, scrape ('brad)./n. Compare: hrad.

To tear to pieces, rend asunder, to rip open (an animal) To cause to be shameless, to do with out, to break, violate a promise or law 1. To spew forth from a hole in the outer layer of. 2. For something old to become rags, tatters To violate, break./n. Compare: hral.

/p.འདྲི་ /ps.དྲིས་ འདྲིས་ /f.དྲི་ /imp.དྲིས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.དོགས་གནས་དང་གཏམ་སོགས་་ btam. gtam. /m. To ask, to ask for, enquire after To ask another person to clarify key unknown points, or one's own ignorance To ask.

/p.འདྲིད་ འབྲིད་ (). /ps.དྲིད་ བྲིད་ /f.དྲིད་ བྲིད་ /imp.དྲིད་ བྲིད་ འབྲིད /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.སྒྱུ་ཐབས་སོགས་ཀྱིས་་('drid) sgyu thabs kyis ('brid) bslu ba'i /m. To entrap, delude, deceive, beguile, impose on To deceive, to delude To interest hither through deceptive means or objects To deceive.

/p.འདྲིལ་ འགྲིལ་ (). /ps.དྲིལ་ /f.འདྲིལ་ དྲིལ་ /imp.དྲིལད་ དྲིལ་ /vl. /tr. (def. 3)/synt. [e.a] 'to roll (into)'.[a.o] 'to roll down'.Denominative of:རིལ་བ་ «round» (Sprigg 1970: 16), 'scroll'(Rona-Tas 1978: 359). hril po 'round, globular, dense' (Rona-Tas 1978: 359)/m. 1. To roll down, to be rolled along, be ￼rolled down. 2. To be joined, entwined, wrapped, enveloped. 3. To wrap up, to coil, to roll about To be rolled along, to be rolled down, to be struck 1. To bring together in one place. 2. To make round, into a ball, roll up 1. To make round, form into a ball. 2. To roll up (e.g. a scroll painting). 3. To gather./n.(Rona-Tas 1978: 359) calls 'dril 'to be turned, rolled round, twisted into a thing.' the 'passive' of 'gril 'to be twisted, to be turned round' with sgril 'to wind up, roll, wrap' the 'transitive'.

/p.འདྲིས་ /ps.འདྲིས་ /f.འདྲིས་ /imp.འདྲིས་ -./inv./int. /ch.ex.ལུས་སེམས་ལ་་/m. To be well acquainted with, to know intimately, to be accustomed to To be acquainted with, to be known, to be used to, to be associated with 1. To acquire familiarity with. 2. To be fond of, to love To get familiar with, to get accustomed to.

[e.a] (Hackett ￼2003)/ch.ex.གནས་སུ་་ gnas dang gzhan du zas dang gnas nas /m. 1. To draw, to pull. 2. To conduct, to draw along, to invite (dra ma ~, with a terminative of destination and an allative of the enemy) To lead (a campaign) (Uray 1962). 1. To draw, to pull. 2. To conduct, to lead a group of soldiers in war, to lead, guide. 3. To invite. 4. To derogate 1. To lead. 2. (honorific) To give, to pour for someone. 3. To desire, love, crave. 4. To give the scriptural reference for the reason behind the correct view and explanation. 5. To bring, to draw in one direction. 6. To guide 1. To draw. 2. To lead. 3. To offer, give to eat or drink. 4. To cite. 5. To desire, love, be attached to./n. To be separated into two verbs 'dren, 'drens 'invite' and 'drang/drang, drangs 'draw, lead', both attested in Old Tibetan, cf. 'drong

/p.སྡུད་ སྡུ་  /ps.བསྡུས་ /f.བསྡུ་ /imp.སྡུས་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs. 'du, (Laufer 1915: 62)/ch.ex.ནང་དུ་མཐའ་ནས་་ mtha nas nang du dband dang 'khor sogs /m. To collect, gather, mass together, range together, to assemble, to put together. 2. To unite, join, condense, add together To collect, bring together, gather, conclude To collect, gather (scattered things into one place). 2. To summon, call hither. 3. To conclude, draw to a close. 4. To make fewer. 5. To rule, have power. 6. To shrink, contract smaller 1. To gather, assemble, bring together. 2. To tie, bind./n.(Stein 1942: 205) suggests this verb is connected to dud 'tie' sdud 'join, unite, marry' mdun ma 'spouse', 'dun ma 'council, association, society, fiance' mdud pa 'knot' and the word dun-ma 'assembly' found in Dunhuang texts with the variants 'dun tsha, 'dun sa, mdu tsa, and bdun tsa. To this adds sdud 'fold of a garment.' For wider speculation about cognates and possible Sino-Tibetan connections compare (Bodman 1969).

To deteriorate, weaken (belief, mental vigor &c.) To be defeated unmatched by the other side.

To be raised, elevated, promoted, advanced. 3. To flutter, to move to and fro (A. 16) To increase, to become higher, increase, to go higher up, fly up, to pulse 1. To multiply. 2. /p.འཕིབས་ འབུབས་ /ps.ཕིབ་ ཕིབས་ /f.དབིབ་ དབུབས་ /imp.ཕིབས་ /vl. /ch.ex.ཐོག་སོགས་་/m.To pitch a tent, roof, umbrella./n. Compare: 'bubs.

To take from the body (wool &c.). 3. To take something from one direction and drive away To expel out, drive away.

To flow forth, heave, smell (of fluids). 4. To range, roam about, gambol To move, to wave, to throb 1. To leap, surge upward. 2. For the mind to flitter about because of one condition. 3. To appear to change, to transform one's self, to cause illusions, to alter an object by magic. 2. To be mistaken, err, to make blunders. 3. To separate, sort, discriminate (the good from the bad, truth from falsehood) (Ja) For a false meaning to arise, manifest to mind or senses To manifest magically, to move.
/p.འཕྲེ་ /ps.འཕྲེས་ /m.To incline, to lean against, to put down, to lay down.

/p.འཕྲེང་ འཕྲེངས་ /ps.འཕྲེངས་ འཕྲེང་ ཕྲེང. /f.འཕྲེང་ /imp.ཕྲེངས་ -./inv./int. /ch.ex.སེམེས་ལ་ཀྱེ་མ་སྙམ་དུ་་/m.1. To fasten, be fastened to, be affixed to, be arranged (especially in a settled and orderly manner) To be anxious, to be attached, enthusiastic To think about a person or thing.

/p.འཕྲོ་ འཕྲོས་ /ps.འཕྲོས་ ཕྲོ་ /f.འཕྲོ་/imp.འཕྲོ་ འཕྲོས་ phro - /inv./int. /synt. [Abs. Abl.] [a.o]./res. spro2/ch.ex.འོད་ཟེར་སོགས་་/m.To proceed, issue, emanate from, to spread, diffuse To emanate light and mind 1. For light to shine. 2. For the mind or eyes to wander 1. To radiate, shine. 2. To wander.

/p.འཕྲོག་ དཕྲོག་ (Rdo 46). /ps.ཕྲོགས་ ཕྲོག་ (Rdo 46) /f.དཕྲོག་ འཕྲོག་ (Rdo 46). dbrog /imp.ཕྲོག་ (Zeisler 2004: 349). phrogs, ￼. /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.གཞན་གྱི་ནོར་སོགས་་ gzhan nor sogs rgyu nor /m.To rob, run away with, to deprive of To rub, to snatch, to grab, to attract 1. For someone to take something by force which had not been given. 2. To take by force for oneself. 3. To bring to mind To take, assemble by force.

/p.འཕྲོད་  /ps.འཕྲོད་ ཕྲོད་ /f.འཕྲོད་ /imp.འཕྲོད་ ཕྲོད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:, /int. /synt. [Abs.]. [a.o]./res. sprod /ch.ex.སྨན་སོགས་དང་ཕྱག་ཏུ་་ /m.To be given, bestowed, offered, delivered To receive, to be recognized, to be fit or suitable, to be benefited or helped by being suitable For something give to arrive in hand. 2. To conform, to be appropriate. 3. To be mentally certain 1. To receive something given, to obtain, receive in hand. 2. To be suitable, to be in harmony, to help. 3. (archaic) To gather, assemble.
བང་ give as a present of འབང༡་
/p.བད་  /ps.བད་ /f.བད་ /imp.-./inv./int. /m.1. To be satisfied by food, sated, full. 2. To become drunk, intoxicated 1. To be satisfied. 2. To become drunk, intoxicated.

/p.བུད་ /ps.བུད་ /f.བུད་ /imp.-./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /res. 'bud, /m.To come out, away.
/p.བུར་ /ps.བུརད་ /f.བུར་ /imp.བུརད་ /m.To be dislocated, to become crooked.
/p.བུལ་ /ps.བུལད་ /f.བུལ་ /imp.བུལད་ /m.To become slow, to be slow.
/p.བད་  /ps.བད་ /f.བད་ /imp.-./inv.,
/p.བེམ་ /ps.བེམ་ /f.བེམ་ /int. /m.To become numb.
/n.(Denwood 1991: 136) suggests the following forms bel, 'bel, 'phel, spel, phe'u, 'phe'u, with the meanings 'declare, make known, publicize, expose, accuse.'
བོ་ gives as the present of འབོ་

/p.བོན་ འབོན་ /ps.བོནད་ /f.བོན་ /imp.བོན་ འབོནད་/ch.ex.ལྷའི་སྔགས་སོགས་་/m.(archaic) To express, to mutter 1. To ask (a god, sovereign). 2. To give, offer (to a god, sovereign). 3. (for a god, sovereign) To receive, obtain, take. 4. (probable) to murmur, recite (charms, prayers). 5. (probable) To invoke, summon, call (Uray 1964). To express, recite, mutter./n.very likely related to the noun bon, and (Lalou 1953) suggests also a comparison with bod 'tibet'
/p.བོར་  /ps.བོར་ /f.བོར་ /imp.-./inv./int. /res. 'bor /m.1. For somethingto become lost 2. To wane, disappear, throw away. 3. To say, do To lose.
/p.བྱང་ /ps.བྱང་ /f.བྱང་ /int. /m.1. For experience to be great. 2. To make something soft, smooth through wiping, touching.

/p.བྱབ་ འབྱབ་ /ps.བྱབས་ /f.བྱབ་ /imp.བྱོབས་ འབྱབས་ /vl. /tr. /m.1. To cleanse, wash, wipe. 2. To seize, clutch To haul down, to remove filthy matters, to wash, clean To rub, sweep To sweep, clear away, wipe.

/p.བྱམས་ /ps.བྱམས་ /f.བྱམས་ /imp.བྱམས་ -./inv./int. /ch.ex.བུ་གཅེ་སོགས་ལ་་/m.The opposite of dislike, to be near at heart 1. To want another to have happiness. 2. For clothes to fit, be comfortable on the body.
བྱི་ gives as the present of འབྱི་
བྱིང་ gives as the present of འབྱིང་ or སྤྱིང་

/p.བྱིལ་  /ps.བྱིལ་ /f.བྱིལ་ /tr. /m.To rub, spread (unguent, salve).
བྱུག་ gives as the present of འབྱུག་
Auxiliary:byung Function:Suffixed to the past tense of a verb meaning 'to make, do'./n.from the verb 'byung. [].

/p.བྱེད་ /ps.བྱས་ /f.བྱ་ /imp.བྱོ་ (Zeisler 2004: 348). byos byed /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /ch.ex.ལས་་/m.To do, to make To do, work 1. To do, work. 2. To replace, substitute, take responsibility for To do the work of mind, speech, or body.
/p.བྱེར་  /ps.བྱེརད་ /f.འབྱེར་ /imp.བྱེརད་/ch.ex.སོ་སོར་་/m.To separate, disintegrate, destroy.
/p.བྱོར་ /m.To hear, listen to.
[1]/p.བྲ་ /m. To have great plenty, be in great plenty./n. Root given as bra < *mra.
[2]Auxiliary:bra./fn.To be able, to withstand, endure.

/p.བྲན་ འབྲན་ /ps.བྲནད་ བྲན་ /f.བྲན་ /imp.བྲན་ བྲནད་ བྲོན /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.ཆབ་སོགས་་/m.To saturate with water, to moisten 1. To pour water. 2. To strew To make wet by pouring water something on it 1. To scatter, disperse. 2. To give, provide.
བྲབ་ gives as the present of འབྲབ་
བྲི་ give as the present of འབྲི༡་
བྲི་ gives as the present of འབྲི༢་

བྲིམ་ gives as the present of འབྲིམ་

[2]བྲུབ་ gives as the present of འབྲུབ༢་
བྲུལ་ gives as the present of འབྲུལ་

/p.བྲེད་  /ps.བྲེད་ /f.བྲེད་ /imp.-./inv./int./m.To be alarmed, depressed at heart, to be dejected, to be ashamed To fear, be afraid of.

/p.བྲོ་  /ps.བྲོ་ /f.བྲོ་ /imp.བྲོ་ -./inv./int. /synt. [o.a] Denominative of:རོ་ «taste» (Hahn 1973: 440)/m.1. To swear, take an oath. 2. To taste, to get enjoyment of. 3. (in Center) To desire, to wish To taste, experience in a taste 1. To have direct experience, mentally appear. 2. To experience with the nose or tongue 1. To desire. 2. To arise, experience./n.(Hahn 1973: 440) suggests that the ro 'taste' < *bro, i.e. the b- is indeed part of the root.
/p.བྲོད་ /ps.བྲོད་ /f.བྲོད་ /int. /m.To be joyful, to enjoy.

/p.བླག་ བློག་ /ps.བླགས་ /f.བླག་ /imp.བླགས་ བློགས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.རྣ་བ་སོགས་་/m.1. To attend to, to hearken to, to lean toward, to permit. 2. To shed tears (Ja) (only used with rna or rna ba) To incline one's ear to, to listen to (de Jong 1973). To give, lend one's ear; to listen to 1. To hear by mentally concentrating, lending one's ear. 2. To cry 1. To lend one's ear to a saying, listen. 2. To give off, shed.
/p.བླད་  /ps.བླད་ /f.བླད་ /imp.བླད་ བློད་ /vl. /tr. /m.To chew To chew cud, to chew (archaic) To chew To chew, grind, suck on./n. Compare: ldad.
/p.བླས་ /ps.བླས་ /f.བླས་ /tr. /m.(for a soft, thin thing) To connect by plaiting together many strands./n. Compare: sla2.

/p.བླུ་ /ps.བླུས་ /f.བླུ་ /imp.བླུས་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.སྲོག་སོགས་་/m.To ransom, redeem (a pawn, pledge, or security) To buy back, redeem; to redeem [the] life of a man, animal by paying some money; to ransom (honorific) To buy To buy something previously relied upon, (particularly) to buy for a religious purpose./n. Compare: the noun glud 'ransom'.
བླུག་ give as the present of ལྡུག་
བླུད་ give as the present of ལྡུད་

Present(?): blod (Denwood 1991: 136). /m.To counsel, discuss, place (Denwood 1991: 136).

/p.དབུར་  /ps.དབུརད་ དབུར་ /f.དབུར་ /imp.དབུར་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.དབྱིག་སོགས་ཀྱིས་་/m.(also 'ur and yur) To smooth (Ja) To rub, scrape 1. To crush finely. 2. To smooth, level.

/p.དབེན་  /ps.དབེནད་ དབེན་ /f.དབེན་ /imp.དབེན་ དབེནད་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /synt. [a.i]/ch.ex.འདུ་འཛི་སོགས་ལས་་/m.To become empty, to be empty, to be without To lack, to have few To be empty, to lack./n. suggests that dbyen 'difference, schism, discord' derives from dben 'solitude, loneliness, separation' via p alat aliz at ion.
དབོག་ gives as the present 'bog
/p.དབོལ་  /ps.དབོལད་ /f.དབོལ་ /imp.དབོལད་ /m.To draw up water from a tank To discharge water from a pond, to let out water through a hole of a pond, to pierce.

/p.དབྱིན་ /m.To incite, instigate, set on.

/p.དབྱུག་ /ps.དབྱུགས་ /f.དབྱུག་ /imp.དབྱུག་ /vl. /tr. /ch.ex.བེར་ཀ་སོགས་་/m.To swing, brandish, throw, cast, fling(Ja) To throw, to cast, to give up, to bend with a stick To move back and forth something with an elongated shape 1. To hurl, strike, jab. 2. To throw out, abandon./n. Compare: gayug.

/p.དབྱེ་  /ps.དབྱེ་ /f.དབྱེ་ /tr. /m.To make distinctions, to differentiate To separate into groups because of some ordinary characteristic./n. according to (Rdo. 46) the present of ཕྱེ་ according to (Ja) future of and in literary a secondary form of 'byed.

དབྲུལ་ gives as a causative of rul presumably he means to refer to 'brul.

/p.འབགས་ འབག་  /ps.དབགས་ འབགས་ སྦགས. /f.དབག་ དབགས་ འབག /imp.དབོགས་ འབགས་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/int. /res. sbag, /ch.ex.དྲི་སྐྱོན་སོགས་ཀྱིས་་ skyon /m.1. To defile, pollute one's ￼self, to soil, make filthy. 2. (Central) To take away, to steal, rob To be polluted, to be defiled, to become impure, to be defective To mix with something else, to make unclear 1. To be polluted, defiled. 2. To use up./n. Compare: 'phog.

[1]/p.འབང་ བང་ /ps.བངས་ /f.འབང་ བང་ /imp.འབོངས་ - /inv./int. /res. sbong, /m.To get wet, to become wet, to be saturated, soak For a thing to be soaked in a liquid and the inside of that thing to saturated with water To become naturally wet.

/p.འབད་ /ps.འབད་ /f.འབད་ /imp.འབོད་ འབད་ /vl. /int. /synt. [Erg. Obl.]./res. rbod /ch.ex.ཉམས་ལེན་སོགས་ལ་་/m.1. To endeavor, to try, to exert one's self, make effort. 2. To cultivate, rear, take care of To try, to endeavor To strive for a goal with great effort of speech and body To strive, exert effort./n.Compare: 'bung.

[1]/p.འབབ་  /ps.བབས་ བབ་ /f.བབ་ འབབ་ (dialect) dbab /imp.བབ་ བབས་ བོབས 'bob 'bobs - /vl. /inv./int. /synt. [a.o]./res. 'bebs /ch.ex.དུས་སོགས་ལ་་/m.1. To move downward, to descend, to come down from, to alight, to fall down To rain, to climb down 1. To go, fall from a higher place to a lower. 2. To rain. 3. To become smaller, fewer. 4. To understand, rise in the mind. 5. To be agreeable, pleasant. 6. To be established, arise. 7. To take responsibility for establishing an action. 8. To obtain, arrive in hand 1. To fall from high to low. 2. To arrive.

To bring down, make lower./n.(Stein 1942: 205) suggests comparison with several words (see note at smo).

To eat, to have food To enjoy food [To eat]./n.(Stein 1942: 205) suggests a relationship with the following words: bza' or gza' 'food', zla 'companion', za (in Dunhuang texts) 'woman', gza' (in Gesar) 'planetary demon', gzan 'to devour, to feed'. To these I add the obvious zas 'food'.

To suffix, be a suffix to. 5. To know the characteristics of, recognize, discriminate 1. To know well, be certain of. 2. To have been taken, to have taken effect./n. Compare: note at zin.

[2]/aux.zin /fn.Used in older writings as a perfect affix like tshar denoting that the action is complete and finished. If suffixed to the past stem of a verb, it shows the action is finished, complete Helps show the meaning 'finished'.

To say, speak./n.Although many have bzlas bya'i sngags kyis this spelling is not correct, but bzlas bya does occur in the sense «to think, ponder, know» gives the variation between 'do and zlo as evidence of the sound change zl lzld'd but he likely relies too heavily on. [1]/p.ཡོང་  /ps.ཡོང་ /f.ཡོང་ /imp.ཡོང་ -./inv. /vl./int. /synt. [Abs.] /m. 1. To be patient, to be capable for, equal to. 2. (= 'ong) To come, arrive. To come, become, get (dialect for 'ong and 'ongs) To come, arrive 1. To arrive. 2. To arise, occur.
[2]/aux.yong./fn.1. To occur, be able. 2. For the correct amount to be reached, to be enough, sufficient.

/p.ཡོབ་ /ps.ཡབས་ /f.ཡབ་ /imp.ཡོབས་ /m. To gather, heap up ￼.

To horripilate 1. To itch. 2. To shake, shudder./n. Compare: the nouns gayan 'itch' and gaya' 'rust'. gay ar gayar. give as the present of གཡོར་

/p.གཡས་ /ps.གཡས་ (ngag dbang tshul khrims 1997). /f.གཡས་ /imp.གཡས་/ch.ex.ང་རྒྱལ་སོགས་ཀྱིས་གཞན་ལ་་/m. (archaic) To borrow, lend./n. Compare: with this verb gayor 'borrow, lend'.

/p.གཡུར་ /ps.གཡུར་ /f.གཡུར་ /int. /m. To fall asleep./n. Compare: yur2

[1]/p.གཡེང་ ཡེང་ /ps.གཡེངས་ ཡེངས་ /f.གཡེང་ ཡེང་ /imp.ཡེངས་ གཡེངས་ -.Iནནོལུནཏརཡ:/tr. Intransitive /synt. [a.o] /ch.ex.གཏོལ་མེད་པར་ཕྱོགས་སུ་་ sems /m. 1. To swing, waft, flow, agitate, move a thing softly to and fro. 2. To agitate the mind, to turn off the attention to disturb the mind. To cause to be idle, to distract (gayeng) To be idle, to distract one's mind from, to loose one's attention (yeng) 1. To be distracted. 2. To lay out, spread (a cover &c.) To be wild, dispersed (gayeng) For thoughts to not stay, but move elsewhere (yeng).
[2]/p.གཡེང་ /ps.གཡེངས་ /f.གཡེང་ /imp.-./inv./int. /m. To float on water.
/p.གཡེམ་ /ps.གཡེམས་ /f.གཡེམ་ /imp.གཡེམས་ /tr/m. To involve in adultery, to have voluntary sexual intercourse with a married person To conduct without manner To have inappropriate conduct.

To be idle, lazy, slothful. To forget, be idle, be lazy 1. To break a promise. 2. To open the mouth of a woolen skirt. 3. To be distracted, lazy 1. To wander, move about. 2. To forget. 3. To be apart from, separate from.

[1]/p.གཡོ་  /ps.གཡོས་ /f.གཡོ་ /imp.གཡོ་ /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a]./cs. gayo2/ch.ex.བཟའ་བའི་ཟས་དངས་སོགས་་ zas dang'gul ba'i /m. 1. To move, remove. 1. To knead, make paste, boil, cook. 2. To change, move To knead mud, boil food 1. To knead, stir, cook. 2. To jostle, shake.

To signal, to beckon (gayab).To wave hands, to wave, to give signal with a hand 1. To swing, flap (a hand, a fan &c.). 2. (colloquial) To couple, have sexual intercourse 1. To make a sign by bending the hand. 2. To draw together in one place.

[1]/p.གཡོར་ གཡར་  /ps.གཡརད་ གཡར་ /f.གཡར་/imp.གཡོརད་ གཡོར་ /vl., /tr. /synt. [Erg. Obl. Abs.] /ch.ex.གཞན་གྱི་ལག་སོགས་ནས་་ yo byad /m. To borrow, hire. To borrow, lend, hire, give or take loans 1. To use a thing belonging to someone else. 2. To have someone use some thing belonging to oneself To borrow, loan.

/p.རི་  /ps.རི་ /f.རི་ /imp.རི་ -./inv./int. /m. To estimate the worth of something. To value, ￼￼￼￼￼to be worthy of To market at a price To be an appropriate price./n. Compare: the adjective rin 'price' and the verb brin 'to market' [].

/p.རིག་  /ps.རིག་ /f.རིག་ /imp.རིག་ -./inv./tr. /int. /synt. [a.o] /m. 1. (with terminative of the substantive) To know, understand. 2. (with terminative of the infinitive) To know that, to perceive. To understand, to comprehend, to apprehend To see with the eyes 1. To see. 2. To know, to understand.

To be allowable, permissible, suitable To be suitable, proper, allowed To be agreeable, suitable, alright.
/p.རིངས་  /ps.རིངས་ /f.རིངས་ /imp.རིངས་ /m. To make haste. To be in a hurry, to hasten.
/p.རིད་ /ps.རིད་ /f.རིད་ /imp.རིད་ /m. To grow weak, to deteriorate.
/p.རིལ་  /ps.རིལད་ རིལ་ /f.རིལ་ /imp.རིལད་ -./inv./int. /m. To fall, to tumble down To roll down, fall down.
/p.རུག་  /ps.རུགས་ རུག་ /f.རུག་ /imp.རུགས་ རུག་ /vl. /tr. /m. To bend. To get together, assemble, bend down To collect together things scattered apart.
[1]/p.རུང་  /ps.རུང་ /f.རུང་ /imp.རུང་ -./inv./int. /synt. [a.o] /m. To be fit, capable for, suitable, right. To be permissible, to be serviceable, to be eligible To be alright, permissible.
[2]/aux.rung./fn.(suffixed to present of a verb) To be suitable, permissible.
/p.རུད་  /ps.རུད་ /f.རུད་ /imp.-./inv./int. /m. (archaic) To fall, drop down, crumble, pulverize To crumble, fall down.

[1]/p.རུབ་  /ps.རུབས་ རུབ་ /f.རུབ་ /imp.རུབས་ - /inv./int. /ch.ex.མན་པོས་་/m. To join, to get together, to collect, to unite, to group 1. To become dark, obscure (of clouds, gloom &c.). 2. To close, tighten the interstices within cracks, splits. 3. To gather many things to one place To close./n. Compare: 'drub.
[2]/p.རུབ་ /ps.རུབས་ /f.རུབ་ /imp.རུབས་ /vl. /tr. /m. To help through cooperation.
/p.རུམ་  /ps.རུམ་ /f.རུམ་ /imp.རུམ་ /vl./tr. /m. To heat another by covering with ones own body To huddle up for bodily heat .

/p.རུལ་  /ps.རུལད་ རུལ་ /f.རུལ་ /imp.རུལད་ -./inv./int. /res. srul 'brul /m. 1. To go bad, to get rotten, to turn rancid. 2. To thaw (of snow). To get rotten, to go bad For the bacteria inside the body of creatures to deteriorate the body To rot, putrefy./n. Compare: 'drul.
/p.རེ་  /ps.རེས་ re /f.རེ་ /imp.རེས་ re -./inv./tr. /int. /ch.ex.འདོད་པ་སོགས་་/m. To hope. To expect, to have a hope To want a matter to happen To want, desire.

To touch, to reach, to attain to To touch, contact directly To touch, contact, attain to, reach./n. Compare: rag.
/p.རེགས་  /ps.རེགས་ /f.རེགས་ /imp.རེགས་ /m. To cut, to shave./n. Compare: 'dreg.
/p.རེངས་ རེང་  /ps.རེངས་ /f.རེང་ /imp.རེངས་ -./inv./int. /m. To become rigid, stiff, to become hard, become untamable 1. To become solid, stiff. 2. To freeze solid.

[1]/p.རེད་  /ps.རེད་ /f.རེད་ /imp.-./inv./int. /m. To make ready, accomplish. To be For bacteria in a flesh wound to become worse 1. To become worse because of other conditions. 2. To be all right, to be ready. 3. To whither, dry out.
[2]/p.རེད་ /ps.རེད་ /f.རེད་ /imp.རེད་/aux. རེད /m. To be /n. For a description of the use of this verb in modern central dialect see.

To smooth, to make even (with a plane, knife &c.). 4. To slide, glide, slip down a slope (Ja). To shoot out directly, to move suddenly and straight or to move swiftly with whispering sound To turn quickly, to shoot out To turn (gsir) To shoot, throw quickly (bsir).

To cut to pieces, split 1. For one thing to be made into many pieces. 2. To multiply small number into a whole number 1. To split, slice, split apart, cleave. 2. (honorific) To wash, rinse, bathe. 3. (honorific) To shave, shear. 4. To urinate./n. Compare: the noun sil ma 'piece, particle, fragment' (Haarh 1969: 298).

To assort wool &c., to pull in pieces To [pick out] individually something matted, tangled (such as wool &c.) To card, differentiate.

[1]/p.འཚོ་  གསོ་  /ps.གསོས་  བསོས་ སོས. /f.གསོ་ /imp.སོས་ gsos /vl. /tr. /synt. [e.a] /cs. sos /ch.ex.ནད་སོགས་་ {srog}. {srog} {sogs} /m. 1. To nourish, pasture, feed. 2. To heal, cure ({'tsho}).1. To feed, nourish, to bring up, nurse up, train. 2. To mend, repair (gso). To nourish, care for by providing the circumstances for life 1. To nourish, sustain, produce. 2. To restore deteriorated things./n.(Uray 1982: 546 n. 3) connects this verb with the noun khab so / khab so pa 'officials who levy taxes', compare 'tsho.
